loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites, age 41, buys and sells bananas to earn an income. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur and has been engaged in her business for six years. She and her husband have seven children, four of whom are enrolled in school. 

Marites is requesting a PhP 17,000 loan through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy more bananas to offer for sale.

In the future, Marites would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy bananas to offer for sale

loans.name: Mirshakar

texts.ru: Миршакар молодой парень в возрасте 23 лет. Он  пока ещё не женат,  но в ближайшем будущем собирается, сейчас занимается поиском подходящей невесты для себя. Живёт Миршакар со своими родителями в сельском посёлке. Он во всём помогает своим родителям, очень их любит, уважает и заботиться об их здоровье. После окончания школы, Миршакар стал помогать соседским пастухам, он помогал им пасти скот на пастбище. И вот уже как 3 года Миршакар сам начал свой бизнес животноводства. Он занимается откормом и продажей скота, и получает от этого хорошую прибыль. Родители помогают ему в этом деле, отец занимается покупкой и продажей скота, а мама ухаживает и выращивает этих скот. Сам Миршакар ещё работает в средней образовательной школе секретарём, и имеет дополнительный заработок от этой работы. Каждый месяц ему приходится тратить много денег на лекарства родителям, чтобы поддерживать их здоровье. Поэтому Миршакар желает расширить свой бизнес, чтобы иметь большое стадо скота и получать больше прибыли от их продажи. Сейчас в наличии у него имеется 3 скота, и он хочет купить ещё несколько голов скота. Поэтому Миршакар обратился в Арванд  и хочет взять кредит для покупки скота. Он надеется на положительный результат, и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Mirshakar is a young man, age 23.  He's not yet married, but plans to wed soon and is searching for a fiance.  Mirshakar lives with his parents in a rural village.  He helps his parents in every way, he loves them very much, respects them, and cares about their health.  After finishing school, Mirshakar began helping neighboring shepherds, assisting while the cattle grazed in pastures.  Now, it's been three years since Mirshakar started his own livestock business.  He fattens and sells cattle and receives good profits from it.  His parents help him with the business--his father buys and cells the animals, and his mother cares for them.  Mirshakar also works as a secretary at a high school to earn additional income.  Each month, he has to spend large amounts of money on medication for his parents to keep them in good health.  Therefore, Mishakar wants to expand his business and increase his herd to increase his profits from sales.  He currently has three cows and wants to buy a few more.  With this goal in mind, he has turned to Arvand to take out a loan to buy the animals.  He hopes for a positive outcom and is grateful to Arvand for the support.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Gayatri Group

texts.en:
This group, formed in the year 2009, is called “Gayatri”. It is a group composed of four women members of the village called Gadramunda. It is located in the Nuapada district of Odisha, India. 

One of the members of this group is Bhanubai, who has raised her hand in the photo on the extreme right. She is 34 years old. She lives with her husband, one son of seventeen years and two daughters of eleven and nine. 

Bhanubai has been running a small bakery factory in her house with the help of her husband for the last ten years. In the bakery factory, items like bread, cream roll, toast, etc. are being prepared. She has engaged three skilled laborers for the processing and making of bakery items. Thirty vendors from fifteen nearby villages come to her factory for taking the product. 

Bhanubai says that owing to better quality, design, packing and forms of her products, there is a lot of demand from the locality, but due to shortage of stock, she is not able to meet the demands. She now wants to buy more stock of oil, dough, sugar, etc. with the present loan to increase her production level to meet the demand and grab her customers. 

From the increased income, Bhanubai dreams to start an ice cream factory for the next summer season. She also hopes to save money from the sale proceeds for providing a better education facility to her children.

The other three active members of the group are Sadabadi, Mangalbai and Simadini, who are running a biriyani restaurant, fish business and tyre-repairing center respectively.

loans.use: to purchase oil, dough, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Mab

texts.en:
Mab, age 39, is a cassava farmer. She lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district. She earns a daily income from her cassava farm, which she has managed for three years. This agribusiness brings her about 33,000 KHR per day. 

Mab is in her fourth loan cycle loan with Kiva partner VisionFund and has repaid her previous loans successfully. The loans have helped her to stabilize her business at a steady pace. She is now requesting a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 KHR, which she will use to pay plowing fees and labor costs as well as to buy cassava seedlings and insecticide for her farm. 

Her goal is to receive a good yield and increase her income.

loans.use: to pay plowing fees and labor costs as well as to buy cassava seedlings and insecticide for her farm

loans.name: Srang's Group

texts.en:
Srang, age 40, is a cassava farmer. She has managed five hectares of cassava crops for many years. She lives with her husband and their children in a wooden house in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. She has five children in total and three of them are still enrolled in school. 

This will be the first micro-loan for Srang's group with Kiva partner VisionFund. The group consists of two female members. They are each requesting the same loan amount of 2,000,000 KHR. Srang is the leader of the group. 

Srang will use her portion of the loan funds to plow her farmland, pay the reaping fees, and lease additional farmland to expand her crop. She hopes that she can sell her cassava at a good price so that she can relieve the financial burden on her family.

loans.use: to plow her farmland, pay the reaping fees, and lease additional farmland to expand her crop

loans.name: Sainath Group

texts.en:
Kamala, an active married lady of 50, is a permanent resident of Khariar town in the Nuapada district of Odisha, India. She is always cheerful in nature. The active and energetic lady standing in the middle with a raised hand in the photograph is Kamala. 

She resides with her husband and one son of 28 years. To increase the income of her family, in the year 2009, she, along with four other like-minded women of her locality, formed a group named Sainath and availed a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. This is the fourth loan for her.

Kamala herself has been running a fancy store with ladies’ fancy items and cosmetics for the last fifteen years in the heart of the town. She basically sells items like bangles, talc, combs, oil, face cream, plastic items, cosmetics, ornaments, etc. She brings the stock for her fancy store from the wholesale market 200 kms away in another state. The joyfulness of Kamala attracts many customers to her shop. 

Presently, she earns a monthly income of 10,000 INR. She wants to increase the volume of her business to earn some extra income. So, from this loan amount, Kamala wants to purchase bulk items of bangles, talc, combs, oil, face cream, plastic items, cosmetics, ornaments, etc. She hopes to develop her shop into a showroom with quality items in the future.

The other four members of the group are Gitanjali, Surindar, Chhayadevi and Sita. They are running a fancy store, iron and steel materials shop, bangle store and barber shop.

loans.use: to purchase bangles, talc, combs, oil, face cream, plastic items, cosmetics, ornaments, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tomatoes at wholesale.

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.ru: Зухро позитивная и жизнерадостная женщина в возрасте 30 лет. Она замужем и имеет троих детей. После окончания сельской школы, Зухро не продолжила своё обучение, так как родители сразу выдали её замуж. С тех пор Зухро занимается домашним хозяйством, ухаживает за мужем и растит детей. Но для того, чтобы иметь доход в семье, они оба занимаются маленьким бизнесом. Зухро работает на рынке, занимается торговлей продуктов питания. Постепенно она расширяет свой бизнес, на сегодня она уже имеет свой ларёк для продажи продуктов, а также расширяет их ассортимент. Её муж работает дехканом. Они вместе получают хороший доход, которого хватает на пропитание. Но Зухро и её муж мечтают о собственном большом и просторном доме, где будут жить их дети со своими семьями. Сейчас они ютятся в маленьком домике с не очень благоприятными условиями для проживания. Поэтому Зухро начинает закупать и заготавливать материалы для строительства дома. И сейчас она хочет взять кредит в Арванд для того, чтобы закупить строительные материалы для строительства дома. Она надеется на поддержку, в следствии чего улучшится качество жизни её семьи.
texts.en: Zuhro is a positive and cheerful woman, age 30.  She is married and has three children.  After finishing high school, she did not continue her education since her parents immediately married her off.  Since that time, she has worked in the home, caring for her husband and children.  However, to provide an income for her family, both she and her husband run a small business.  Zuhro works at a market and sells food goods.  She is consistently developing her business and now has her own stall to sell from as well as space to expand her inventory.  Her husband works as a farmer.  Together, they bring home a good income which is enough to provide for the family.  However, Zuhro and her husband dream of building their own home where they will live with their children and their children's families.  Now, they live in a small little home that doesn't provide very favorable conditions.  Therefore, Zuhro has begun purchasing building materials for their home.  Now, she wants to take out a loan through Arvand to buy more construction materials.  She relies on the support which will allow her to improve the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Isatu, age 30, prepares and sells food to earn an income. She lives with her husband and their two children in Tombo, which is in a western rural area of Sierra Leone. The children are aged two and seven and are both attending school.

Isatu has been operating her cookery business for the past 10 years. She began her business because needed to generate income to help support the family. She works 10 hours per day and seven days per week. She says that her main challenge is the lack of enough capital to run her business smoothly.

Isatu is requesting a loan in order to buy palm oil to offer for sale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to grow her business and improve her family's standard of living.

In the future, Isatu plans to continue to expand her business. 

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy palm oil to offer for sale

loans.name: Thai

texts.en:
Thai, age 53, is the breadwinner for an extended family consisting of 10 children, three of whom are in school. He is a rice farmer. For many years, he has grown rice on three hectares of farmland to earn an income, and he also plants cassava and grows rubber trees. The agribusiness brings him about 29,000 KHR per day. 

This will be Thai's first loan cycle with Kiva partner VisionFund. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 2,000,000 KHR in order to buy rubber tree seedlings for planting. 

He hopes to generate more income to support his family and to marry off all of his children.

loans.use: to buy rubber tree seedlings for planting

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Zulaikho

texts.ru: Зулайхо 43 года.  Она замужняя женщина и мать одного сына. В последние годы муж с ними не живет. Хотя они  не разведены, но у мужа отдельная жизнь. Зулайхо одна воспитывает сына и она всегда старается работать усердно, чтобы сын ни в чем не нуждался. Сейчас Зулайхо хотела бы открыть швейное дело. Она умеет шить национальные женские платья и делать на них вышивку. Она уже знает кто будет ее первыми клиентами: это близкие родственники, соседи, подруги. Зулайхо планирует в день вышивать по два платья, одно простое, а другое с вышивкой. Чтобы реализовать свою цель Зулайхо просит кредит для приобретения компьютерной швейной машинки и ткани. Благодаря кредиту Зулайхо будет иметь собственный прибыльный бизнес и жизнь семьи - ее и сына намного улучшится.
texts.en: Zulaikho is 43 years old, married, and the mother of one son.  In recent years, her husband has not lived with her and her son.  They are not divorced, but her husband has a separate life.  Zulaikho is raising her son as a single parent.  She always tries to work diligently so that her son doesn't go without anything he needs.  She would like to open a sewing business.  She is able to fabricate the national women's dress and embroider it.  She already knows who her first clients will be: her close relatives, neighbors, and friends.  Zulaikho plans to sew two dress a day, one simple, the other more ornate.  In order to achieve this goal, she is asking for a loan to buy a computerized sewing machine and fabric.  Thanks to this loan, Zulaikho will have her own lucrative business and her life, as well as her son's, will be considerably improved.

loans.use: to buy a computerized sewing machine and fabric

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es: Doña maria de 59 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de verduras  tomates, cebollas, chiles entre otros tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el lugar donde comercia es muy estratégico para la actividad y además muy concurrido de personas, ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefiere porque su producto es fresco, a buen precio, de calidad y con un excelente servicio; doña maria  es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a su labor con muchas ganas de salir adelante, siempre está buscando alternativas que le permitan alcanzar el éxito, quiere realizar una nueva inversión pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar verduras por mayor. Doña maria tiene buenas referencias de pago, esta agradecida con el apoyo y asegura que podrá saldar la deuda, a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Maria is 59 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and son. She sells vegetables - tomatoes, onions, peppers, etc. She has spent several years in the business which has given her extensive experience in sales, allowing her to make the most income. 

The place where she does business is very strategic and also very busy with people. She has many customers that prefer her because her products are fresh and of good quality, and she has good prices and excellent service. Maria is an enterprising woman, dedicated to her work and eager to get ahead. She is always looking for alternatives that will allow her to succeed. She wants to make a new investment but doesn't have enough capital to back it. She is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow her to buy vegetables wholesale. Maria has good payment references, and is grateful for the support and ensures that she can pay off the debt, and at the same time she trusts that she can give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale vegetables.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Eva from the Tombo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with two children, ages 12 years and 18 years. Her two children are currently attending school. 

In 2007, Eva established her food stand business. She began her business because she was trained in business and she needs to generate income to support the home. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of enough capital to run her business.

Eva requires a loan in order to buy more cooking seasonings, rice and butter for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her level of living. 

In the future, Eva plans to expand her business even more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more cooking seasonings, rice and butter for resale.

loans.name: Haja

texts.en:
Haja, age 35, sells spare motor parts to earn an income. She has been running this business since 2001. She works at the business 10 hours per day and seven days per week.

She lives with her husband and their two children, ages six and ten, in Tombo, which is in a western rural area of Sierra Leone. Both her children are attending school. 

Haja says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business. She has requested a loan in order to purchase more spare parts to offer for sale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to start a savings account and increase her business. 

In the future, she plans to open a clothing shop. 

She thanks you for your support

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to offer for sale

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah, age 40, runs a general merchandise business. She lives with her husband and their two children in Tombo, which is in a western rural area of Sierra Leone. 

Hannah has been engaged in her business since 2008. In her store, she sells such items as soda, milk, cigarettes, and biscuits. She says that the main obstacle she faces is lack of sufficient capital to expand her business.

Hannah has requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone in order to buy soda, milk, cigarettes, and biscuits to offer for sale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and improve her family's standard of living. 

In the future, she would like to buy a plot of land. 

She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy soda, milk, cigarettes, and biscuits to offer for sale

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: Don felix vive junto a su esposa en casa propia,  él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y  frijol tiene muchos años de dedicarse a la agricultura por lo que se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en el rubro, es muy conocido en la zona y ya tiene buena clientela pues obtiene las mejores cosechas, por lo tanto comercia producto de primera calidad y a precios muy accesibles, además el servicio es inigualable, don felix se caracteriza por su gran amabilidad, es un hombre emprendedor con muchas ganas de salir adelante, piensa que aprovechar las oportunidades lo llevaran un paso más adelante del éxito; en la última siembra no obtuvo las ganancias esperadas y esta vez quiere aumentar la producción, pero necesita de un apoyo de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semillas, abonos, herbicidas, fertilizante, etc. don felix tiene referencias de tener una moral intachable, responsable y de muy buena paga, confía que podrá responder a la deuda y al mismo tiempo podrá darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Felix lives with his wife in their own home. He works cultivating corn and beans and has devoted many years to agriculture so he has a lot of experience in the industry. He is well known in the area and already has a good customer base. He gets the best crops so he sells quality products at very affordable prices, and the service is unmatched. Felix is characterized by his great kindness; he is an enterprising man eager to get ahead. He thinks taking advantage of opportunities will take him one step closer to success. 

In the last crop he did not get the expected returns and this time, he wants to increase production, but needs more capital. He is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow him to purchase seeds, manure, herbicides, fertilizers, etc. Felix has references that he has good moral character, is responsible and has a good record of payment. He is confident that he can pay off the debt and at the same time give his family a full life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, herbicides, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 35 years old and married with one child, age 3 years. She runs a fish business in Tombo Western rural area in Sierra Leone. She started this business to get her daily living. Her husband is a fisherman, but his income is not enough to support the home.

She's been in this business since 2006 and sells fish within her community. She says that at present, her business is doing well because out of the profit, she was able to take of her family.

Victoria requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more fish for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and change her status of living. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business to a higher level. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale.

loans.name: Abie

texts.en:
Abie is 25 years old and married with two children, ages 1 year and 3 years. She runs a fish business in Tombo Western rural area in Sierra Leone. She started this business to get her daily living. Her husband is not working at present.

She's been in this business since just after she got married, and sells fish within her community. She says that at present, her business is doing well because out of the profit, she was able to take care of her family.

Abie requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more fish for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to increase her business and have a permanent business location. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business to a higher level. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana operates a fishing business to earn an income. She lives in Narra, Palawan, with her husband and their two children. She earns an additional income from raising chickens. She works hard to support her family.
 
This will be Susana's fourth loan from NWTF. Her previous loans have helped her significantly in sustaining her business. She is now requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 13,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy necessary fishing materials for her business.

Susana hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money for business expansion.

loans.use: to buy necessary fishing materials

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana, age 63, runs a general store to earn an income. She has operated her business for five years and also earns an income from rice retailing. She and her husband have four children, and she works hard to provide for her family. Juana has borrowed and repaid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan, and her previous loans have helped her significantly in sustaining her business.

Juana is requesting a PhP 22,000 loan through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy additional items to sell, such as canned goods, milk, sugar, candy, and soft drinks.

Juana aspires to save enough money to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy such items as canned goods, milk, sugar, candy, and soft drinks to offer for sale

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily buys and sells vegetables to earn an income. She is a hard-working entrepreneur and has been engaged in her business for eight years. She also operates a general store for additional income. 

She is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy additional vegetables to offer for sale.

Emily has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to offer for sale

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma runs a general store business to earn an income. She earns additional income from food vending. She lives in Narra, Palawan, with her husband and their seven children. She works hard to support her family. Guillerma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF.
 
Guillerma is borrowing PhP 20000 through NWTF in order to purchase goods like soap, shampoo, eggs, noodles, and canned goods to offer for sale.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase goods like soap, shampoo, eggs, noodles, and canned goods to offer for sale

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 35 años de edad, está casada pero por el momento no tiene hijos, vive en su casa propia. El negocio de Rosa consiste en la venta de productos comestibles tales como arroz, azúcar, pan, leche, huevos, aceite, embutidos, harina, verduras, bebidas y otros. Todos los días desde muy temprano abre las puertas de su tienda para atender a sus clientes que llegan hasta su establecimiento en busca de algún producto con la seguridad que ahí encontrarán lo que necesitan. Su tienda  es la única de su zona por lo que siempre tiene buenas ventas, además de eso el trato cordial y la amabilidad que expresa en cada una de sus palabras son las cualidades perfectas para que sus clientes estén siempre agradecidos. Lleva en este negocio 1 año y asegura que fue la mejor elección laboral que pudo tomar. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500, agradece a todas las personas que le brindan la oportunidad de acceder al financiamiento que requiere para que continúe trabajando. Por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado comprará cierta cantidad de productos como arroz, huevos, leche, ciertas verduras y frutas.
texts.en:
Rosa is 35 years old, married, and has no children.  She lives in a house she owns.  Rosa's business sells food products such as rice, sugar, bread, milk, eggs, oil, canned goods, flour, vegetables, beverages, and other items.  She opens the doors of the store very early to serve the customers who come to her store in search of a product that they are sure they will find there.  Her store is the only one in the area, so it always has good sales.  In addition, her friendly and kind treatment that she expresses in each of her words are the perfect qualities to always please her customers.  She has had this business for a year and she is sure that it was the best work choice she could have made.  

Currently she is requesting 1500 soles.  She is grateful to all the people who provide this opportunity to access the financing she needs to continue working.  For her part, she promises to make her repayments on time.  With the loan requested, she will purchase a certain quantity of products such as rice, eggs, milk, and certain vegetables and fruits.

loans.use: to purchase rice, eggs, milk, and other items for her store.

loans.name: Maria Eddy

texts.es: Maria Eddy 50 años de edad soltera con dos hijos ambos mayores de edad e independientes originaria de uno de los municipios de Chinandega donde predomina el comercio, Maria inicia su negocio de compra venta de cerdo y destace del mismo, desde muy temprana ya que era un negocio familiar el cual hereda negocio que ahora es propio y tiene mas de veinte años, ella vende y compra a la misma vez realiza destace una vez por semana donde ofrece deliciosos nacatamales, pepenas, fritos, morongas, charrascas, chorizos entre otros , sus compras las realiza al contado en comarcas aledaña, sus ventas son al contado y al crédito que principalmente recupera los quince y treinta de cada mes, porque ofrece sus productos a clientes asalariados, uno de sus sueños es de mejorar sus vivienda, María Eddy esta solicitando financiamiento para capital de trabajo compra de cerdos en pie.
texts.en:
Maria Eddy, age 50, is single and has two grown and independent children.  She is from one of the Chinandega municipalities where commerce is most important.  Maria started her business of buying, selling, and butchering pigs at a very early age.  It was a family business, which she inherited, and it is now her own.  She has had it for over 20 years.  She sells and buys at the same time, and she butchers once a week.  

She sells delicious tamales, ‘pepenas’ [a traditional dish], fried foods, blood sausage, pork cracklings, and sausages, among others.  She makes her purchases for cash in surrounding communities.  She sells for cash and for credit, which she mainly collects on the 15th and 30th of each month.  She does this because she sells her products to salaried customers.

One of her dreams is to improve her house.  Maria Eddy is requesting a loan to buy live pigs.

loans.use: to buy live pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el cliente se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 2 años y eso le ha dado la capacidad y el conocimiento necesario para asistir sus cultivos, su principal siembra es el maíz y la sandia, comercializa sus cultivos en los mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos que su familia tiene, vive en casa propia con su familia, el cliente esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar insumos agrícolas que le ayuden en la siembra de sus cultivos como: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, herbicidas, herramientas, etc. asi como muestra la fotografia y  asi poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando en los gastos de su casa sin ninguna limitación.
texts.en:
The borrower has worked as a farmer for 2 years, which has given him the ability and knowledge necessary to care for his crops.  His main crops are corn and watermelon.  He sells his harvest at the markets that are close to his home.  With the income he earns from his sales, he helps with the expenses his family has.  He lives in his own home with his family.

The borrower is requesting this loan to purchase farming supplies that will help him plant his crops such as manure, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, and tools, as shown in the photograph.  This will help him earn more income and continue helping with the household expenses without limitations.

loans.use: to purchase manure, seeds, fertilizer, herbicides, and tools.

loans.name: Jorge  Alberto

texts.es: Don Jorge de 58 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos en casa propia, se dedica al cultivo de maiz desde hace varios años cuando ya ha pasado la cosecha se dedica a vender hamacas por las diferentes colonias donde el reside. De esta forma es como se gana la vida y puede llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. La actividad del cultivo la realiza año con año, y es la única forma que conoce de cómo ganarse la vida. Es un hombre muy trabajador, honrado y responsable. A pesar de las condiciones en las que vive, las cuales son muy humildes no se cansa de trabajar y de dar lo mejor a su familia. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito para comprar los principales insumos agrícolas: abonos, venenos para plagas, semillas, fertilizantes, etc. Espera tener resultados favorables ya que no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos. Confía en Dios que logrará obtener una cosecha abundante la cual le permitirá seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar.
texts.en: Jorge, age 58, lives with his wife and three children in his own home. He has cultivated corn for several years, and when the harvest is over he sells hammocks in the area. This is how he makes a living and provides his family with their daily bread. He cultivates year in, year out, and this is the only way he knows to make a living. He is a very hard-working, honest, and responsible man. Despite the humble conditions in which he lives, he never gets tired of working to give his family the best. He has decided to request a loan to buy basic agricultural supplies: manure, pesticides, seeds, fertilizer, etc. He hopes to have good results because he does not have another source of income. He trusts God that he will obtain an abundant harvest which will allow him to provide his family's daily bread.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides, seeds, manure, etc.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza, de 42 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos con quienes vive desde hace mucho tiempo en un cuarto alquilado. El trabajo de Maritza consiste en la venta de jugos y diversos desayunos, actividad que realiza en el frontis de su vivienda en donde diariamente instala una mesa, sillas, licuadora y todos los productos que prepara con anticipación para sus clientes. Elabora variados jugos de frutas hechos con piña, naranja, quinua, manzana y panes con queso, mantequilla, huevos y palta. Trabaja en este oficio más de 2 años y lo hace con ayuda de sus hijos. Se siente muy a gusto desarrollando su trabajo ya que su esfuerzo es retribuido con los buenos ingresos económicos que obtiene a diario. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000, está muy contenta al saber que tiene un respaldo económico para seguir avanzando en el cumplimiento de sus metas.  Se compromete a ser una socia puntual con cada uno de sus pagos. Con el monto solicitado comprará una batidora eléctrica y todos los insumos que usa para elaborar sus potajes como panes, huevos, palta, quesos, frutas, azúcar y otros.
texts.en:
Maritza, age 42, is a single mother of three. She has lived with her children in a rented room for a long time. Maritza sells juice and various breakfasts from the front part of her home. Every day, she sets out a table, chairs, a blender, and all of her products in anticipation of her customers' arrival. She makes varied fruit juice with pineapple, orange, quinoa, and apple, as well as bread with cheese, butter, eggs, and avocado. She has done this work for over two years and she does it with the help of her children. She is very comfortable with this work, since her hard work is rewarded with the good income that she makes daily. 
She is requesting 2,000 soles. She is very happy to know that she has economic support to advance with her goals. She promises to be punctual with every single repayment. With the requested loan, she will purchase a blender and all of the ingredients that she uses for making her food, such as bread, eggs, avocado, cheese, fruit, and sugar.

loans.use: to buy bread, eggs, and avocados, as well as other items for her business.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of five children, Lucia  works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from food vending and raising livestock. Lucia is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, sugar, rice, groceries, etc. to sell for her general store business.

Lucia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like, soft drinks, sugar, rice, groceries, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Nezel

texts.en:
Nezel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 16,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional items like sugar, can goods, groceries, etc. to sell for her general store business.

Nezel has been in this business for two years. Nezel earns additional income from raising livestock.

Nezel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like sugar, can goods, groceries, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 54 years old and has seven children. Emily is married and has one child who is in school.

Emily is in the agricultural business farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Emily requested a 17,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Emily has been farming sugarcane for five years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Emily would like to save money to expand her farming business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Flordelina

texts.en:
Flordelina is 57 years old and married with one child in school. Flordelina works very hard to provide for her children.

Flordelina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy household goods like soap, canned goods, milk, sugar, shampoo, egg, etc.

Flordelina has been in this business for 20 years.

Flordelina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy household goods like soap, canned goods, milk, sugar, shampoo, egg, etc.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, chips, can goods, milk, coffee, etc for her general store business.

Ofelia has been in this business for six years. Ofelia earns more income from food vending and farming sugarcane and rice.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to build her general store and farming sugarcane and rice.

Ofelia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, chips, canned goods, milk, coffee, etc

loans.name: Evic

texts.en:
Evic is 34 years old and married with three children, who are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Evic is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional feeds, vitamins, and other supplies for her pigs.

Evic has been raising pigs for 12 years and also earns additional income from having a sugarcane truck for rent.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds, vitamins, and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 63 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Anita is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy rice seeds, fertilizers, and other farm supplies.

Anita has been farming rice for 10 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice grains.

In the photo, you see her sitting in her newly purchased sacks of rice seeds. 

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy rice seeds, fertilizers, and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Bernandita

texts.en:
Bernandita is 62 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Bernandita is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to pay for laborer's salaries and buy fertilizers for her farm.

Bernandita has been farming sugarcane for 10 years and also earns additional income from raising livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to buy farm lands.

loans.use: to pay for laborer's salaries and buy fertilizers for her farm

loans.name: Dolly

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Dolly works hard to support her family.

She has a bakery business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from general store and farming rice. Dolly is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like flour, margarine, sugar, etc. for her bakery business.

Dolly has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like flour, margarine, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Encarnación

texts.es:
Encarnación tiene 50 años de edad, es viuda y tiene tres hijos.  Es una persona mayor de edad luchando día a día por salir adelante y cumplir lo que siempre se ha propuesto. Creció junto a sus padres, quienes le enseñaron a trabajar la agricultura y en las fincas de café de la zona donde vive; sus papas en ese tiempo poseían una pequeña tienda en donde aprendió del negocio. Luego se caso a los 18 años, procreo tres hijos ya ahora mayores de edad, su esposo murió hace 28 años. Sus hijos emigraron para estados unidos, ella actualmente vive con sus cinco nietos en la casa. Antes trabajaba vendiendo verduras en el mercado de la ciudad, el cual tenia que caminar desde las montañas donde ella vive por 45 minutos, luego tomar el bus hasta la ciudad. Hoy en día posee una pequeña tienda en la comunidad de la cual obtiene ingresos económicos a la familia.
La mercadería la adquiere en la ciudad, para llegar ahí tiene que caminar en muchas ocasiones por 45 minutos hasta llegar al pueblo de donde ella toma el bus, para ir a la ciudad, que luego lleva a la comunidad para venderla. Ella vende productos de la canasta básica, como frijol, maíz, arroz, aceite, además vende medicina y otros productos para el hogar.
El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundacion Campo,  es para comprar ladrillo, cemento, arena pago de mano de obra; para ponerle el piso a su  casa, pues es de tierra y desea ponerle ladrillo. Con la inversión, poseerá una vivienda mas digna, pues con esfuerzos muy grandes ha construido la vivienda, ahora le falta el ladrillo, para que junto a sus nietos vivan mejor, debido a que corren el riesgo de contraer enfermedades en los pies a causa de la humedad.
Planea comprar un estante más grande, para  colocar sus productos, y ayudar a los nietos en los estudios.
texts.en:
Encarnación is 50 years old. She is a widow with three children. She is an older woman who works hard every day to get ahead and reach her life goals. She grew up with her parents, who taught her to work in agriculture and on the coffee farms in the area. Her parents owned a small store where she learned the business. Encarnación got married at the age of 18 and had three children who are now grown. Her husband died 28 years ago, and her children emigrated to the United States. She now lives with her five grandchildren in her home. She used to work selling vegetables in the city market. She would have to walk 45 minutes from the mountains where she lives, and then take the bus to the city. She now has a small store in her community which provides an income for her family.
She buys her merchandise in the city. To get there, she has to walk. It often takes 45 minutes to get to the village where she catches the bus for the city. She then brings her products back to her community to sell them. She sells basic staples such as beans, corn, rice, and oil. She also sells medicine and other household products.
This loan, which she is requesting from Fundacion Campo, is for the purchase of bricks, cement, and sand, and to pay labourers to install a floor in her home. They currently have a dirt floor and she wants to install brick. With this investment, she will have a more dignified home. She has built her home through great hard work, and now she needs bricks so that she and her grandchildren can live a better life. They currently run the risk of getting infections in their feet from the humidity.
She plans to buy a larger display case to display her products, and to help her grandchildren with their studies.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, and sand, and to pay labourers to install a floor in her house.

loans.name: Felecidad

texts.en:
Felecidad is 60 years old and married with four children.

Felecidad works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like oil, sugar, can goods, groceries, etc. to sell.

Felecidad has borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns an income from having a sugarcane truck for rent and farming sugarcane.

Felecidad aspires to save enough to buy farm lands.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like oil, sugar, canned goods, groceries, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty works hard to support her family. Betty is widowed and has a business buying and selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines.

Betty requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional fruits and vegetables to sell.

Betty has been in this business for 8 years now.

In the future, Betty would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Jubelyn

texts.en:
Jubelyn is 36 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. Jubelyn runs a general store  in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as milk, sugar, coffee, canned goods, noodles, eggs, etc. to sell.

Jubelyn has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for 16 year and also earns an income from selling prepaid mobile phone load.

Jubelyn aspires to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items such as milk, sugar, coffee, canned goods, noodles, eggs, etc. to sell

loans.name: Suzette

texts.en:
Suzette is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. Suzette earns additional income from motorcycle transport.

Suzette is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. Suzette dreams of saving enough money that she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her food production

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly, de 42 años de edad, es una mujer alegre, luchadora y emprendedora. Está casada con Cayo quien es comerciante  y padre de sus 2 hijos, con quienes vive en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Nelly es la venta de madera como listones, tablillas y otros para paredes y pisos. Toda esta madera la compra en las fábricas de madera y las vende desde su casa donde tiene un espacio acondicionado para cumplir esta labor, atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes por lo que ha logrado ganarse la preferencia de cada uno de ellos y gracias a eso es muy recomendada. Se inició hace 3 años con un capital propio, vendiendo en pequeñas cantidades, luego fue aumentando sus ventas gracias a la demanda de este producto.  Antes de empezar a desarrollar esta actividad tuvo dificultades económicas ya que los gastos aumentaron con la llegada de sus hijos, por lo que se vio en la necesidad de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar por  eso optó por realizar este trabajo , además que obtiene muy buenas ganancias. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 3800, está agradecida y contenta al saber que sigue contando con el apoyo financiero que necesita para avanzar con el progreso de su negocio. Por otro lado se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará madera para cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Nelly, age 42, is a happy, hard-working, and enterprising woman. She is married to Cayo, a businessman, who is the father of her two children. They all live together in their own home. Nelly sells wood such as slats, boards, and other kinds used for walls and floors. She buys the wood from the factories and sells it from her home, where she has a small space outfitted for this activity. She provides very good customer service, so she has gained the favour of each one of them and comes highly recommended. She started her business three years ago with her own capital, selling wood in small quantities. She was able to increase her sales thanks to the demand for this product. 
Before starting this business, she had economic troubles because their costs increased when they had children. She found it necessary to help her husband with the household costs, so she decided to do this work. She makes a very good income.
She is requesting 3800 soles and is grateful and thankful to know that she continues to have the financial support she needs to move forward with her business. She promises to repay her quotas punctually. With the requested loan, she will purchase wood to fill pending orders.

loans.use: to buy wood to complete pending orders.

loans.name: Cleomeline

texts.en:
Cleomeline works hard to support her family. She is married and has a used clothing sales business in the Philippines. Cleomeline has been in this business for two years now.

Cleomeline requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of used clothes to sell. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of used clothes to resell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fruit and vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. Erlinda earns additional income from buying and selling rice.
 
Erlinda is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. Erlinda dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 35 years old and married with four children.  With her four children in school, Joan works very hard to provide for them.

Joan runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like soap, canned goods, milk, eggs, spices, etc. She has been in this business for 13 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Joan would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell such as soap, canned goods, milk, eggs, spices, etc.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma works hard to support her family. Thelma is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Thelma requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Thelma has been in this business for 8 years now.

In the future, Thelma would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Joselyn

texts.en:
Joselyn is 35 years old and married with two children.

Joselyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like spices, soap, milk, soft drinks, eggs, noodles, etc.

Joselyn has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from selling gasoline.

Joselyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like spices, soap, milk, soft drinks, eggs, noodles, etc

loans.name: Ma. Charina

texts.en:
Ma. Charina is 36 years old with one child who is in school. She works hard to support her family. Ma. Charina has a business selling used clothing in the Philippines. She has been in this business for nine years now.

Ma. Charina requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of used clothing to sell.

In the future, Ma. Charina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, de 21 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Vive en la casa de sus padres en compañía de sus 3 hermanos. Julia se dedica a la venta de carne de res, para eso cuenta con un puesto instalado en el mercado principal de su localidad donde atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes. Se inició hace 3 años con un capital propio ya que vio la necesidad de generar su propia fuente de ingresos , al principio tuvo la ayuda de sus padres pero poco a poco fue independizándose. Le gusta su negocio pues le permite interactuar con las personas, del mismo modo los ingresos económicos que obtiene le ayudan a colaborar con sus padres en los gastos de su hogar y el pago de sus estudios universitarios. Por otro lado, lo que no le gusta es que algunos de sus clientes le solicitan créditos por sus compras a lo que ella se niega pues ya tuvo malas experiencias con ese tipo de ventas. Tienen planes de implementar su negocio y así seguir creciendo generando así  más ingresos económicos. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 3800 y está muy contenta por el apoyo financiero que le brindan para que pueda seguir adelante con su trabajo, por está razón se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.Con el monto solicitado comprará una sierra de corte de carne y carne de res para mejorar la calidad de los productos que ofrece.
texts.en:
Julia, 21 years old, is single and doesn't have children. She lives in her parents' house with her 3 siblings. Julia works by selling beef. For this business, she has a stand in the main market of her town, where she cheerfully attends to her customers. She started the business 3 years ago with her own capital since she saw the need to earn her own source of income. At first, she had help from her parents but slowly became independent. She likes her business because it allows her to interact with people. Also, the income she earns lets her contribute to household expenses along with her parents, and pay for school. On the other hand, she doesn't like that some customers ask to purchase on credit, which she doesn't allow because she has had bad experiences with those type of sales. She has plans to implement her business and keep growing and earning more income. 

At this time, she is requesting 3,800 soles and she is very happy to have the financial help provided to her, which allows her to move forward in her job. This is why she promises to make payments punctually. With this loan, she will buy a variety of meat cuts and beef to improve the quality of products she offers.

loans.use: to buy meat to improve the products of her business.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en: Francisco feels his family isn't doing enough to protect the environment that has given them their livelihood. In order to shift away from expensive and polluting LP gas and firewood, he is purchasing a 10 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester. Using the waste from his animals, his system will generate enough biogas for cooking and heating bathwater in not only his house but also his father's house, only a few meters away. The system will also generate rich, potent organic fertilizer he will use to improve his crop yields without having to resort to expensive and unsustainable agrochemical options. This loan represents 30% of the total cost of his 10 cubic meter biodigester.

loans.use: To purchase a 10 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Meraluna

texts.en:
Meraluna is 37 years old and married with six children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Meraluna is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Meraluna has been raising pigs for 17 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: José Apolonio

texts.en: José Apolonio and his family have been farming in Tlaxcala for generations and agriculture represents their primary source of income. He is investing in a 10 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester because he wants to more effectively treat the animal waste produced on his farm, while concurrently benefiting from the renewable bio-gas and potent bio-fertilizer generated by his system. His family will use the bio-gas to cook and heat bathwater and the bio-fertilizer will be used to improve crop yields without having to resort to agrochemical fertilizer use. This loan represents 51% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: To purchase a 10 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Ricardo Felipe

texts.en: Ricardo, who has been farming for over 40 years, prides himself on his maize yields. However, he has noticed that his soils just don't produce like they used to. Ricardo hopes to return life to his soils in the form of liquid biofertilizer, generated using his 40 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester. Through the purchase of his system, he expects to increase yield while concurrently decreasing input costs and reducing the environmental impact of his farm due to better waste management and decreased agrochemical fertilizer use. This loan represents 70% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: To purchase a 40 cubic meter Sistema Biobbolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Jamila's Group

texts.en: Jamila, aged 45, is a housewife. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband manufactures plastic bottles and sells them in the market. This business is the only source of income for the family. He wants to purchase plastic for his business, however due to financial constrains he finds it difficult. Jamila, as a member of this two-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. He will use the loan amount to purchase plastic for manufacturing plastic bottles to sell. With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to invest in household needs. Jamila hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase plastic for manufacturing plastic bottles.

loans.name: Juan Luis

texts.en:
Peru's Juan Luis, working alongside his wife, Carmen (pictured at right), specializes in handcrafted jewelry with mate gourds and gemstones. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of fine silver to increase production.

Juan Luis has been selling through NOVICA since 2006. This is his story:

"We love to let our imagination run free and be as creative as we want to be," Juan Luis confides. "We are inspired by everything we see, even by the discarded pieces from other things we made! We put them together and play with them, like a jigsaw puzzle. I love to see how mistakes can be transformed into beautiful things."

"Thank you from the bottom of our hearts for taking part in this microcredit. It will help us work-wise, and this in turn will benefit our family. We'll be able to prepare a larger stock so we may have more designs and increase our sales."

Use the link below to view Juan Luis's silver jewelry with mate gourds and gemstones on the NOVICA site:

http://www.novica.com/kiva/6054

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of fine silver for his jewelry.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es: Fernando, de 21 años de edad, es un hombre amable y emprendedor. Es soltero y no tiene hijos. Vive en casa de sus padres, en compañía de su familia. La actividad que realiza Fernando esta orientado al sector de la electricidad. Su función consiste en realizar arreglos a los equipos eléctricos tales como televisores, equipos de sonido , lavadoras, entre otros, del mismo modo desarrolla trabajos de electrificación y alumbrado de viviendas para ello elabora planos de acuerdo al perfil solicitado, tiene en su casa una computadora que emplea para ejercer su labor con buenos resultados. Aprendió este oficio estudiando en una escuela de electricidad y lo pone en práctica desde hace 2 años. Ahora trabaja con empresas privadas que necesitan de su servicio. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es que le ha permitido tener ingresos económicos sustanciales con el cual poder pagar los gastos propios de su hogar y darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hermanos. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000, está muy contento de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. El préstamo solicitado lo invertirá en su totalidad en la compra de herramientas básicas de electrónicas como pinzas, cables, guantes, entre otros.
texts.en: Fernando is 21 years old.  He is a friendly, enterprising man.  He is single, doesn’t have any children, and lives with his family in his parents’ home.  Fernando’s business is oriented toward the electricity sector.  His job is repairing electrical appliances such as televisions, sound equipment, washing machines, and other items. Similarly, he works on electrification and residential lighting projects designing plans according to the profile requested.  In his home, he has a computer that he uses in order to perform his job with good results.  He learned this trade by studying at an electrician school and put his skills in practice two years ago.  Currently, he works with private companies that need his services.  What he likes about this business is that it allows him to have substantial income, which enables him to pay for his own expenses and provide his siblings with a better quality of life.  At this time, he is requesting S/. 2000.  He is very happy to know that he will have financial support because, in this way, he feels confident in moving forward with his business. Once again, he promises to make his payments on time.  He will invest the entire amount of the requested loan in the purchase of basic electronic tools such as pincers, cables, gloves, and other items.

loans.use: to purchase basic electronic tools such as pincers, cables, gloves, and other items.

loans.name: Reziel

texts.en:
Reziel is 28 years old and married with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Reziel has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

In the future, Reziel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Regine

texts.en:
Regine is 29 years old and married with three children.

Regine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy stock to sell like soap, candy, canned goods, milk, sugar, etc.

Regine has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from raising carabao (water buffalo) and chickens and farming rice.

Regine aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy stock to sell like soap, candy, canned goods, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Herjen

texts.en:
Herjen is 33 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. Herjen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, spices, etc. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport.

Herjen has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She aspires to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, spices, etc.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 42 years old and married with five children, two of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them. Delia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks such as noodles, soft drinks, spices, soap, etc. to sell. She has been in this business for 13 years.

In the future, Delia would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks such as noodles, soft drinks, spices, soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Cheryl works hard to support her family. She has a travel and tour agency business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from furniture making. 

Cheryl is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to pay for employees' salaries and maintenance of her transport van for her travel and tour agency business.

Cheryl has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to pay for employees' salaries and maintenance of her transport van

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling ready to wear [clothing] in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years. Rowena earns additional rental income from a boarding house and from a general store.

Rowena is borrowing 17,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her ready to wear business. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her ready to wear clothing, general store and boarding house businesses. Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Mary Anna

texts.en:
Mary Anna is 30 years old and married with two children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Anna runs a business buying and selling jewelry in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. She requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of jewelry to sell.

In the future, Mary Anna would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Lilliam Yaneth

texts.es:
Lilliam, tiene 27 años de edad y vive con sus suegros, disfruta de dos hijos, los cuales tienen edades de 5 y 9 años. Ella posee una tienda para mantener a sus hijos, este oficio lo inicio por iniciativa propia, lo realiza desde hace 2 años y lo desempeña todos los días de 6:00am a 7:00pm.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar productos de la canasta básica tales como: azúcar, frijoles, arroz, bebidas, sal, aceite, huevos, jabón, entre otros; esta inversión le ayudara a fortalecer el negocio e incrementar sus ingresos.
Su sueño es brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Lilliam, 27 years old, lives with her in-laws and has two children ages 5 and 9. She has a shop to support her children. She started this business on her own iniciative two years ago and she works every day from 6am to 7pm.

The loan she is requesting will allow her to buy daily use products such as sugar, beans, rice, drinks, salt, oil, eggs, soap, and other items. This investment will help her strengthen her business and increase income.

Her dream is to offer her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sugar, beans, rice, drinks, salt, oil, eggs, soap, and other items.

loans.name: Jennelyn

texts.en:
Jennelyn is married and has a meat vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years now. Jennelyn works hard to support her family. 

Jennelyn requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of meat to sell. In the future, Jennelyn would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of meat to sell

loans.name: Leny

texts.en:
Leny is married and has a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for a year and works hard to support her family.

She has requested a loan of 29,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to purchase soap, sugar, milk, coffee, cream and other items to sell.

In the future, Leny would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase soap, sugar, milk, coffee, cream and other items to sell

loans.name: Oscar Elias

texts.es:
Oscar, requiere optar por un nuevo préstamo porque necesita más capital de trabajo para iniciar la siembra de granos básicos; este le permitirá comprar los insumos agrícolas requeridos tales como: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, entre otros.
El efecto que tuvo el crédito anterior fue favorable, ya que aumento la producción y sus ingresos los invierte en los gastos del hogar; la inversión del crédito ha mejorado su situación económica y se encuentra muy bien de salud toda su familia.
texts.en: Oscar needs to take out a new loan because he needs more working capital to start planting basic grains. This will allow him to buy agricultural materials he needs, such as: fertilizer, herbicide, pesticide, insecticide, and more. The effect of the previous loan was favorable, since production increased and he invests his income in the household expenses. The investment of the loan has improved his financial situation and he and his family are in very good health.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide, pesticide, insecticide, and more.

loans.name: Luis Yair

texts.es: Luis de 28 años de edad vive con su cónyuge y se dedica al comercio de correas y hebillas al por mayor y al detal, actividad que desde niño ha sido su mayor habilidad y en la que tiene una impresionante aptitud. Anteriormente Luis se encontraba en la parte de afuera, de un centro comercial importante del sur de la ciudad, pero fue reubicado por el estado local y ahora se encuentra en un sitio que destinaron para congregar a los vendedores ambulantes. Su trabajo lo desarrolla desde las 9:00 a.m. a las 9:00 p.m. de lunes a domingo sin descansar; la competencia de este sector es alta, pero se respetan y se apoyan y él trabaja con una vocación de servicio, que atrae a sus clientes. Anteriormente la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo le aplicó un crédito, con lo cual aprovechó la temporada del 2012 para comprar correas, hebillas, accesorios femeninos y masculinos, teniendo éxito en su inversión, aumentando el surtido de mercancias, ligeramente su capital de trabajo y la liquidéz las ventas y la sutilidades de la empresa. Su sueño más importante es lograr tener su vivienda propia y ampliar su microempresa. Con su credito anterior mejoró su liquidéz su capital de trabajo y los ingresos familiares. El da muchos agradecimientos a la Fundación y desea seguir recibiendo ese apoyo financiero, para continuar progresando en su negocio y en su vida familiar. Este es su primer credikiva, el cual lo invertirá en los mismos productos que el anterior crédito: correas, gafas, carteras y estuches para gafas entre otros articulos para seguir incrmentando las ventas y utilidades del negocio, con ello tendrá un buen surtido porque está bien ubicado y ofrecerá precios justos y este es el éxito de su credikiva.
texts.en:
Luis, 28 years old, lives with his spouse and works by selling belts and buckles wholesale and individually, a job he has done since he was a child. This has been his greatest ability and is something for which he has an aptitude. Previously, Luis was further out of town from an important shopping center in the southern area of the cry. However, he relocated and now he is in an area intended for street vendors to set up. 

He works from 9am to 9pm Monday through Sunday without breaks. The competition is high in this area, but they respect and support each other. He works in the service sector, which attracts customers. The Fundación Mario Santo Domingo gave him a loan before, which helped him in the 2012 season to buy belts, buckles, and women's and men's accessories. This slowly increased his merchandise stock, his working capital, sales liquidity, and the subtleties of the business.

His biggest dream is to have his own home and increase his small business. With the last loan, he improved his liquid working capital and family income. He is grateful to the Fundación and wants to keep receiving financial aid so he can keep progressing in his business and family life. This is his first Kiva loan, which he will invest in the same products as with the first loan: belts, glasses, wallets, and glasses cases among other items. This will increase his sales and the usefulness of his business. With the loan, he will have a good supply because it is in a good location and he will offer fair prices, which is the success of his Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy belts, glasses, buckles, and glasses cases.

loans.name: Soek

texts.en:
Soek, 59, has seven children. She lives in a rural village in the district of Bovel in the province of Battambang in Cambodia. She and her husband have been in farming rice and growing cassava and corn for 10 years. The current business earns about 84,000 Cambodian riel (KHR) per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
Soek is just with VisionFund for this cycle. She is applying for a loan of 2,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income and make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch, 32, is married with one child residing in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. To support the family, she has been farming rice and selling grocery items for eight years while her husband works as a paid worker in the local area to better support the family. Together, they can earn about KHR 26,000 per day and save about KHR 15,000 each day for future needs.

Touch has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan, which has helped her better support her living condition. Now she is applying for another loan of KHR 3,000,000 to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She will also use a portion of it to spend on buying more grocery items for resale. She hopes to make more income from the current business so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Hay's Group

texts.en:
Hay, 48, lives in a rural village in the Battambang Province’s Moung Russey District. She is the married mother of eight children, two of whom are dependents who are still in school. Her family’s income comes from leasing a rice paddy of 1.5 hectare. She has been in this business for ten years to make a living. From her current business, she can earn about 15,000 KHR per day and manage to save about 10,000 KHR per day for her future needs. 
Hay has been with VisionFund for four cycles and has fully repaid her past loans. She has successfully used it to better support her living. Now leading her group to ask for a loan, Hay who, the leader, is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to extend her farmland to increase her business so she can earn more income to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Alaa is a married Palestinian woman from Tulkarm. She is a mother with two sons and one daughter. All of Alaa's children are in the school. Alaa's husband works as a laborer with a low wage which is not enough to cover all the family needs. 

Alaa has requested a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help Alaa to pay the costs of repairing the family home since it is very old. This will offer the family better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the costs of repairing the family home

loans.name: Heng's Group

texts.en:
Heng is aged 49 years and married with six dependent children. Three of her children are still in school. She lives in a rural village of the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district. She earns a living through farming rice. In all, she can earn about KHR 28,000 per day from the current business and can save about KHR 10,000 each day for future needs.

Heng has just joined VisionFund this cycle, while the other member has been with VisionFund for two cycles. Now Heng is leading her group to request a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She will also spend a portion of it on labor fees. She hopes to produce more rice and sell it for a good price so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Samart's Group

texts.en:
Samart is a 43-year-old villager from a rural area located in the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district. She is 43 years old and married with five children, two of whom are dependents and still in school. She earns a living through raising pigs. Currently, she keeps five pigs, while her husband patches tires and cleans motors for a fee. Together, they can earn about KHR 35,000 per day from the current business and can save about KHR 20,000 each day for future needs. 

Samart has been with VisionFund for two cycles. She completely paid back the past loans which have helped better support her family. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Samart wants to use her portion to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice on time so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Somaly's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Kampong Cham Province’s Dambae District, Somaly is 42 years old and married with three children, all of whom are dependent and still in school. She earns a living through farming rice to feed and support her family members. Her husband buys and sells coconuts in the village and he is also a taxi driver to better feed the family. Having been in this business for twenty years, she is able to earn about 42,000 KHR per day and manage to save about 20,000 KHR each day for the future needs. 

Somaly has been with VisionFund for two cycles and has completely paid back the past three loans. She smartly used the loans to improve her living gradually. Now leading her group to ask for a loan, Somaly, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy seed and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to produce more rice she can earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for her farmland.
