loans.name: Sokhoern

texts.en:
Sokhoern is a 42-year-old, rural villager from Kandal province's Ponhea Leur district.  She has four dependent children, all of whom are still in school.  Sokhoern has earned a living through farming rice on 3-hectares of farmland.  Having engaged in this business for 20 years, Sokhoern is able to save up to five US dollars per day from her current business, after deducting the expenses. 

This is the second-cycle loan for Sokhoern with Kiva's partner, VisionFund.  The past loan, which she successfully paid back, has helped her to sustain her living conditions as well as her business in a gradual manner.  This cycle she is applying for an educational loan to cover the entire tuition for her daughter, a 21-year-old freshman in a local university who is specializing to be a midwife.  She hopes that this loan will enable her daughter to obtain a higher education and end up with a good job after graduation in order to support the family.

loans.use: to cover her daughter’s university tuition.

loans.name: Kimna

texts.en:
A 42-year-old mother of three children, Kimna resides in a rural village of the Kandal province’s Sa Ang district, Cambodia.  To support her living, she has been growing cabbage and ginger in the village for 20 years.  Her husband is a paid worker to help support her family with enough food.  Together, they can earn about 18,000 KHR per day from the current business and can save about 4,000 KHR each day for future needs.  

This is the first loan for Kimna with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund.  She is applying for a loan of 2,400,000 KHR and will use this loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.  She hopes to increase her family’s business and gain more income to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.  Lina is a married woman from a small village near Tulkarm.  She is a mother with five sons and two daughters.  Lina's husband works as a worker with a low wage that is not enough for the family’s needs. 

Lina took a USD loan from FATEN.  This loan will help her to improve the family home by adding a new room and by building a fence around the house.  This will improve the family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to build a new room and a fence around the home.

loans.name: Rawan

texts.en: Rawan is a 23-year-old single woman from Jenin city.  She is a hard worker in a private company.  Rawan would like to help her family by paying the cost of driving licenses for two of her brothers.  These driving licenses will help them to work as taxi drivers in the city.  This job is very common in Jenin and earns a good income, especially for the youth.  As a result, she took a USD loan from FATEN.  Rawan appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay driving license fees for two of her brothers.

loans.name: Ghalyah

texts.en:
Ghalyah is a 20-year-old single woman from Tulkam city. She owns a small beauty salon for women in the city. It is a very profitable project now because  there are more wedding parties in the summer. This salon has been operating for one year in a small room in Ghalyah's house.

Ghalyah took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help Ghalyah to move her salon to a bigger place. She will also buy the needed stock of beauty products that she uses in the salon. 

Ghalyah appears in the photo, working in her salon.

loans.use: to move her salon to a bigger place and also to buy needed stock of beauty products

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en:
Sokhom is a 43-year-old widow with 4 children.  She is from a rural village located in the Siem Reap province’s Srey Snom district.  For the last 15 years, she has been farming rice to support her family. 

Sokhom has been a member of VisionFund for one cycle already.  She has completely paid back the loan, which has enabled her to better her family’s living condition.  Now she is leading her group to ask for a new loan.  As the leader, Sokhom wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides for her farmland.  She hopes to make more income from her paddy field business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Mazen

texts.en:
Mazen is a 26-year-old single man from Attel, near Tulkarem.  He works as a teacher with a low wage. Mazen would like to complete building his own home to live with his future wife.

Mazen took a USD loan from FATEN.  This loan will help him to pay the cost of purchasing construction materials for his new home.  Mazen appears in Kiva profile picture.

loans.use: to pay the cost of construction materials for his new home.

loans.name: Rehab

texts.en:
Rehab is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Rehab is a 50-year-old married woman. She lives in a humble house in the Tulkarem refugee camp with her husband and four children: three sons and one daughter. Her sons work as a workers with a low wage. Rehab's husband owns a small resturant in the refugee camp where they live. It is a profitable project and a very crowded restaurant. 

Rehab took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help Rehab's husband to improve his restaurant by buying more chairs and tables and doing some internal decorations.

loans.use: to improve the restaurant by buying more chairs and tables and doing some internal decorations.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.es:
Jesusa nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo y vive en la misma ciudad, ella tiene 63 años, es viuda y tiene seis hijos. 

Jesusa es una persona emprendedora y trabajadora que sale adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación pues tiene dos actividades económicas que los distribuye para estar en sus actividades durante el día por ejemplo: en las mañanas hace sus actividades del hogar después en el transcurrir del día se dedica a administrar su tienda de abarrotes y su negocio de venta de combustible. Ya son varios años que se dedica a estos negocios y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Jesusa pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Torrechayoc” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar comestibles como arroz, azúcar y combustible como gasolina, petróleo y así aumentar su capital de trabajo en este rubro.

Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. (La ciudad de Paucartambo es la capital de la Provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Jesusa was born in the city of Paucartambo, where she also currently lives, she is 63, a widow and has six children.

Jesusa is an entreprenurial and hardworking person, she gets ahead with much effort and dedication, because she has two economic activities during the day, for example, in the morning she gets her home activities done, then for the rest of the day she manages her convenience store and her business of selling fuel.  It's been a few years that she has worked on these businesses and she does well because of her hard work.

Jesusa belongs to the community bank "Lord of Torrechayoc" and this opportunity requires a loan to buy rice, sugar, gasoline and oil, this way she will have more working capital.

She is thankful and appreciative of the loan and commits to make her monthly repayments with much responsibility.  The city of Paucartambo is the capital city of the Paucartambo province, in the region of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and fuel like gasoline and oil.

loans.name: Dunya

texts.en:
Dunya is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her son appears in her Kiva profile photo.
Dunya is a 46-year-old married woman from Tulkarem city.  She is a mother with five sons and three daughters.  Most of her children are under 18.  Dunya's husband works as a worker with a low wage that is not covering all of the family’s expenses.  Dunya would like to complete building the new home where her son will live after he gets married. 

Dunya took a USD loan from FATEN.  This loan will help her to buy construction materials for her son's new house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for her son's new house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover the entire tuition fee.

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en: Jamal is 26 years old and lives in Hodeida, Yemen. He is a hardworking man who likes to depend on himself. He works hard to provide his family's daily expenses. He was employed in the public sector. Over time, he has collected a small amount and intends to buy a bus, but he knows that it costs more money, and he doesn't yet have enough money to purchase a bus. He applied for a youth loan of 500,000 YER (Yemen rials) from AMB to buy a bus to increase his daily income. He hopes to improve his living standards and own an extra bus.

loans.use: to buy a bus to increase his daily income.

loans.name: Fawaz

texts.en:
Fawaz is a 39-year-old married man from Jenin city.  He is a father for four children, two sons, and two daughters.  All of his children are under 18 years old.  Fawaz's family works in agriculture, planting legumes in season, which makes for an unstable income.  Fawaz also works as a contractor in Jenin city and the villages around it.  It is a hard job but it gives Fawaz a good income. 

Fawaz would like to buy a new barrow to transfer the construction materials, especially wood and cement, to the site where he works.  This will make his job easier, especially in the hot summer.  For this reason he took a USD loan from FATEN.  Fawaz appears in the photo while he was working in the site.

loans.use: to buy a barrow for his construction job.

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihad is a 19-year-old, single, young man from Qalqilya city.  He is a hard worker even though he is very young.  Jihad works in the local vegetables market.  He buys seasonal crops from the local farmers and resells them.  It is a profitable business but it needs some money for improvement. 

Jihad took a USD loan from FATEN.  This loan will help him to buy more seasonal products to resell to his customers.  This will increase Jihad's income.  Jihad appears in the photo while he was working in the local market.

loans.use: to buy more seasonal products for resale.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph has nearly two decades of masonry installation experience. Beginning at the age of 20, Joseph worked for a masonry company where he perfected his trade and worked independently on the side.

Originally from Ohio, Joseph moved to Austin, Texas at a young age. Once he began working, he noticed there was a need for masonry work on residential and commercial buildings that were considered “small contracts.” As most general contractors decided those projects were too small, Joseph decided to pick them up.

In April 2013, Joseph decided to officially brand himself as a professional businessman and registered his business titling it V2R Masonry Systems. He is the sole employee at the moment but predicts that once he obtains his first project, he will be able to hire an average of five employees.

To deter a delay in finalizing the start-up business, Joseph searched online for small business loans where he first learned about Accion Texas Inc. 

The $5,450 loan allowed the 37-year-old father of one to advertise his business and bid on those contracts “too small” for general contractors. Now that his business has started, Joseph says he is able “to advertise my company to general contractors in a professional manner.” His next step is to complete his website, www.v2rmasonry.com/, and create social media profiles to further advertise his business.

loans.use: to advertise his business and bid on projects.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 39-year-old married man from a small village near Gaza city. He lives in a small house with his wife and four children:  two sons and two daughters. All of them are under 18. He is a worker in the public sector and he gets a low income. So Ali also works as a taxi driver after his job. This gives him enough income and helps him to cover the necessary needs for the family. 

Ali would like to change the car's engine because the old one causes a lot of pollution and needs more oil to work compared to the new ones.

Ali took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help Ali to buy a new engine for his car. This will increase the taxi capacity and also decrease the pollution and the use of oil, which will be a good thing for nature. 

Ali appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new engine for his car

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala is a 28-year-old single woman from Gaza city. For the past year, Hala has been working in a beauty salon she owns. It is a profitable project and Hala is very happy in this job because she is talented, especially in this field. 

Hala took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to develop her salon by buying some equipment like a hair dryer and hair and beauty products. This will develop the salon and increase her income.

Hala appear in the photo in her salon.

loans.use: to buy some equipment and hair and beauty products.

loans.name: Rasha

texts.en:
Rasha is a 28-year-old married woman with two children, a boy and a girl. Her husband works as a worker with a low wage that barely covers the family's needs, so Rasha opened a beauty salon for women one year ago to help her husband with the family expenses. 

Rasha requested a loan from FATEN. This loan will help Rasha to buy some needed stuff to develop her salon like a chair, some decorations and small tools for her job. This will improve the salon and increase its income.

loans.use: to buy a chair and add some decorations and small tools for her salon.

loans.name: Julia Eulalia

texts.es:
Julia nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo y vive en la misma ciudad, ella tiene 52 años de edad, es casada. 

Julia es una persona emprendedora y trabajadora que sale adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación pues tiene una actividad económica que los distribuye para estar en sus actividades durante el día por ejemplo: en las mañanas hace sus actividades del hogar después en el transcurrir del día se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, pan, verduras, conservas y otras cosas más. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Torrechayoc” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar comestibles como arroz, azúcar y así aumentar su capital de trabajo en este rubro. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. (La ciudad de Paucartambo es la capital de la Provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Julia was born in the city of Paucartambo, where she also currently lives, she is 52 and is married.

Julia is an entrepreneurial and hardworking person, she gets ahead with much effort and dedication, because she has an economic activity that requires her to distribute her time. For example, in the morning she gets her home activities done, then for the rest of the day she sells basic products such as rice, sugar, pasta, oil, bread, vegetables, preserved food and other items.  It's been a few years that she has worked on these businesses and she does well because of her hard work.

Jesusa belongs to the community bank "Lord of Torrechayoc" and this time she requests a loan to buy rice and sugar to increase her working capital.  She is grateful and appreciative for the loan and commits to make her monthly repayments with much responsibility. (The city of Paucartambo is the capital city of the Paucartambo province, in the region of Cusco, Peru).

loans.use: to buy food like rice and sugar.

loans.name: Mosa

texts.en:
Mosa is a 26-year-old who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He has a small grocery store that he opened to help with the household expenses. His business is not running well due to the lack of money to stock his business. This is why he's requesting a youth loan of 240,000 YER (Yemen rials) from AMB to purchase grocery products for his business. 

He hopes he can improve his family's financial stability with this investment and enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase grocery products for his business.

loans.name: Maounde's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Tessito gadamayo est créé le 15 Novembre 2006 au jour d’inauguration du banc villageois. Il est composé de  femmes qui toutes issues du même quartier. Les membres ont des liens de parenté. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Maoundé (assise à la troisième rangée à droite avec une main levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette. Malgré son âgé avancé (54 ans), elle reste très dynamique dans le groupe. En plus de son activité commerciale de vente de produits alimentaire, elle fait aussi de l’embouche dans son village natal où elle achète des moutons les engraisse pendant au moins trois mois.

Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter des moutons pour accroître son cheptel en vue de la revente à la veille de la fête de Tabaski.

Avec les retombées, elle apporte son soutien à son mari malade dans la prise en charge des besoins familaux.
texts.en:
The Tessito gadamayo group has been created on November 15, 2006, the day the local banc villageois was inaugurated. The group is composed of women living in the same neighborhood and related to each other. Their main business activity is retail.

Mrs. Maounde (seated in the third row on the far right raising her hand) is the star borrower. In spite of her advanced age (54 years old), she remains a very dynamic group member. In addition t selling good products, she also raises livestock in her village, purchasing sheep and fattening them for at least three months.With this loan she plans to buy sheep to increase her headcount in the anticipation of sales before the Tabaski holiday [Eid al-Adha, a major Muslim holiday]. Thanks to  her revenues, she helps her husband, who is ill, to provide for family needs.

loans.use: to increase her livestock by buying sheep for resale before the Tabaski holiday.

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
Efraín continúa con su profesión de carpintero y tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio donde fabrica diferentes tipos de muebles de madera como por ejemplo sillas, mesas, roperos, camas y otras cosas más. En esta oportunidad Efraín requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo madera, clavos, pintura y otras cosas más. 
  
Efraín  continúa en el banco comunal “Mamacha Rosario” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en: Efrain is still working as a carpenter and has a small shop located in his residence, where he makes wooden furniture, such as chairs, tables, dressers, beds among other things.  In this occasion, Efrain needs a loan to buy materials such as wood, nails, paint and so on.  Efrain continues to work with the community bank "Mamacha Rosario" from the Arariwa Association, he is thankful for the opportunity given to him through this loan and commits to make repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy materials such as wood, nails, paint and other.

loans.name: Mazn Group

texts.en: This group is called Mazn and consists of three ladies who live in Aden, Yemen. Amany is a very active lady and performs her household duties very well by staying at home. She is a 38-year-old married woman and has three children who also live in Aden, Yemen. She has applied for a youth loan of 80,000 YER from AMB for further expansion of her tailoring business. She has great skills in her work and her clients are very satisfied with her work. With the loan investment she will buy a new sewing machine that will allow her to complete client orders on time and increase her profits. She is very much hopeful that she could enroll her children in school.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her business

loans.name: Fachima Group

texts.en: Finda is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Fifty-two-year-old Finda is married to a lorry driver and the couple has one child who is still not of school-going age. Finda has been a businesswoman for 13 years now. She sells cloths. Finda and her group members are requesting a loan of SLL 3,500,000 for the entire team.  With the help of this loan, they will be able to further expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Finda will use her share of the loan (SLL 1,000,000) to expand her business. She will buy a larger quantity of cloths to add to her current ones.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of cloths to add to her current ones

loans.name: Nabeel

texts.en: Nabeel is a 24-year-old, single man who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He operates a cell phone accessory stall. He has been involved in this kind of business for three years. He started his business with a little bit of capital. He is hardworking and has good dealings with his clients. He needed financial assistance so he applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB, which will be used to buy more cell phone accessories and rechargeable phone cards for his business. He believes that he can increase his income to be able to cover his family's needs and become a successful entrepreneur someday.

loans.use: to buy more cell phone accessories and rechargeable phone cards for his business

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 22-year-old young man. He is single and lives with his family. Ahmad's father works as an employee in the public sector and gets a low wage that is not enough for the family's needs. Ahmad has been working in a barber shop for three years. This is a profitable project, but it needs more money to be improved.
 
Ahmad requested a loan from FATEN. This loan will help Ahmad to buy a new chair for his barber shop and also do some decoration. This will increase Ahmad's income.
 
Ahmad appears in the photo while he was working in his shop.

loans.use: to buy a new chair for his barber shop and aslo do some decoration.

loans.name: Shanta Singh

texts.en:
Shanta Singh is 31 years old. She is married and has two children, aged 12 and 2. In 2003, she established her grocery store business. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family.  

She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy grocery goods for her business. In the future, Shanta Singh plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support.  

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called pasals, are an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk and staples such as rice, lentils and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her business.

loans.name: Happiness Group

texts.en: The members of the "Happiness" group are very pleased to inform their Kiva lenders that their last Kiva loan was very helpful to their businesses and their personal lives. With the help of their recently repaid Kiva loan, they were able to add more inventory to their respective businesses. This led to an increase in sales and profit-to-sales margin. With the daily profit they made, they were able to look after their children including feeding, clothing, and sending the children to school. Having very successfully repaid the previous loan, they are requesting a new loan in order to add more inventory to their respective businesses. Doris will again use this loan to buy a larger quantity and variety of slippers and other shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity and variety of slippers and other shoes to sell

loans.name: Chanat Devi

texts.en: Chanat Devi is 42 years old.  She is married and has two children aged 22 and 17.  In 2000, she established her furniture-making business.  Working six days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid four loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy wood for her business.  In the future, Chanat Devi plans to improve her family's economic conditions.  She thanks you for your support.  In Nepal, furniture is still made the old-fashioned way.  Using little more than basic hand tools, skilled artisans form raw lumber into beautifully finished pieces of furniture.  With precision and an eye for detail, furniture makers produce shelves, bed frames, and cabinet sets.  With the help of a Kiva loan, a furniture maker is able to increase the volume of their lumber purchases or hire additional labor.  This additional leverage allows an entrepreneur to increase productivity and profitability.

loans.use: to buy wood for her furniture-making business.

loans.name: Lalita

texts.en: This is 32-year-old Lalita . She is married and has two children, aged 13 and 8. In 2007, she established her coral carving business. Working seven days a week and seven hours a day, she supports her family. This is her fifth loan from Patan BPW, which she has used to increase her inventory of coral. In the future, Lalita plans to expand the business. She thanks you for your support. In Nepal, large supermarkets are rare. Instead, most items can be found in the small, densely packed pasals that line the streets of every city and village. Piled high with utensils, paper goods, and anything else one would need, these stores are your one-stop shop in Nepal. Although usually packed into a space no larger than 100 square feet, these stores carry a sizeable and diverse inventory. With the help of a Kiva loan, pasal owners are able to keep inventory up and their customers happy. Competition is fierce, but with extra capital and a bit of creativity, the opportunity for profit is there.

loans.use: to increase her coral inventory for carving

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala is 24 years old, and from Gaza. She is married and has three children. She has owned a shop for selling cosmetics and accessories since 2011, and has two employees.

She asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy and install a sun shade and an external sign, and to enlarge the space of the shop. She hopes that this loan will help her increase her customers and thus improve her income. The one who appears in the picture is Hala's husband since she refused to take a picture for cultural manners.

loans.use: to buy and install a sun shade, an external sign, and to enlarge the space of the shop.

loans.name: Emanuel El Naranjal Group

texts.es:
La señora Madai Catalina es casada, tiene 35 años de edad, de escolaridad primaria completa, tiene 3 hijos y los 3 estan estudiando, ella se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogos, inició este negocio ofreciendo productos de casa en casa y hasta la fecha lleva ya 3 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la albañilería.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que le va servir para la compra de más productos para que pueda ofrecer variedad y satisfacer las necesidades de sus cleinte, en el futuro desea ver su negocio prosepro y con mas capital de trabajo para poder vender por mayor; las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a vender productos por catalogos y tienda de consumo diario. en la fotografía aparecen 9 integrantes pero solamente a 8 de ellas se les concedió el préstamo.
texts.en:
Madai Catalina is married, 35 years old, finished elementary school, she has three children who are students, she sells products through catalog orders, she started this business offering the products door to door and to this day she has three years of experience, she has the support of her husband who is a construction worker.

She organized a group and requests a loan that will allow her to buy more products, so that she can offer more variety and satisfy the needs of her customers, in the future she wishes to see a successful business with more working capital to do wholesales; the rest of the group members sell products through catalogs and have a convenience store.  In the photo there are 9 members, but only 8 of them were given a loan.

loans.use: to buy catalog products for sale.

loans.name: Dilcia Celina

texts.es:
Dilcia es una mujer de 41 años de edad, es madre de cuatro hijos y en compañía de su compañero de hogar viven humilde mente la casa está construida de adobe, lamina de zinc y piso de tierra, tiene una familia bien consolidada. Sus hijos están en la escuela cursando la educación primaria y ella junto a su pareja trabajan arduamente en sus cultivos de café ya que es el único patrimonio para darles el sustento a sus hijos. Sus cultivos de café están a la par de su casa por lo cual les es fácil dar el mantenimiento y asistencia técnica como: poda, limpieza, fertilización, entre otros.

Actualmente ella solicita un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para mejorar su producción de café comprando los insumos necesarios para su mantenimiento y atención. 

Ella espera que se le apoye con su solicitud ya que es el único medio y forma de ingreso para su familia para que ellos puedan cumplir con sus sueños en su familia los de seguir apoyando a sus hijos con la parte educacional y formar un patrimonio sólido para su futuro. De esta manera quedara satisfecha y con mucha puntualidad cumplirá con el compromiso para poder seguir gozando de sus beneficios y demás servicios.
texts.en: Dilcia is a 41-year-old mother of four who lives with her husband in their humble home made of adobe, a zinc roof and a dirt floor. It is a tight-knit family. Her children are in elementary school, and Dilcia and her husband work arduously in their coffee fields since it its the family's only source of sustenance. The coffee fields are right by the house, making it easy to maintain the crops by pruning, cleaning, fertilizing, etc. Dilcia is requesting a loan from Kiva partner COMIXMUL to improve her coffee production by purchasing needed supplies to care for her crops. She is hoping for the support because it is her only means to earn an income for her family, and in this way she can fulfill her dreams of making progress, continuing to support her children's education and growing her wealth to ensure their future. Thus, she will be satisfied and will fulfill her requirements very punctually so she can continue to enjoy the benefits and other services of her community bank.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to maintain her coffee crops.

loans.name: Women In Action Ii Group

texts.en:
Yei is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Yei was born in Gbane, in eastern Sierra Leone 50 years ago. She is married to a farmer and the couple has three children who are attending secondary schools. Yei sells drinks, sugar, milk, sweets, candles, cigarettes etc. She has had this business for six years now.

With the help of this loan, Yei and her group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Yei will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to buy the abovementioned items in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy drinks, sugar, milk, sweets, candles, cigarettes etc. in bulk to add to her current stock

loans.name: The United Group

texts.en: Members of "The United" group are very pleased to approach Kiva lenders for the second time for a loan. Having repaid their last Kiva loan very successfully, they think it wise to request a new one in order to further boost their respective businesses. Their recently-concluded Kiva loan has been of an immense help in their businesses and personal lives. It enabled them to add more inventories to their respective businesses, and increased their income so that they could better support themselves and family members. With a new loan, they can add more stocks into their businesses and this will again push them to a new height. Amidu, who continues to be the featured leader of this group, will again use it to buy more stationery to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of stationery to add to his business

loans.name: Nely Suyapa

texts.es:
La Señora Nely de 38 años, vive con sus hijos, en su casa de habitación ubicada en una aldea de San Lorenzo, en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 13  años a la venta de productos alimenticios. 
Doña Nely vende de lunes a domingo y sus clientes son sus vecinos y amigos que a diario le visitan,  su negocio está ubicado en su casa.
Doña Nely está solicitando  el préstamo para compra de  más productos alimenticios como arroz, frijoles, manteca, huevos, aceite, papel higiénico, pollo, embutidos, pastas de tomate, espaguetis, refrescos, churros, café, pan, etc.
Doña Nely con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende incrementar más  su inventario y también sus ventas para mejorar un poco su situación económica y la de su familia.
Doña Nely su sueño es poder compra un carro.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – Mayo del 2013.
texts.en: Nely is 38 years old and lives with her children at their home in the small town of San Lorenzo in southern Honduras. She has made a living for the past 13 years selling food products. Nely works seven days a week, and her customers are friends and neighbors who visit her daily. Her store is located in her home. Nely is requesting the loan to purchase more products, such as rice, beans, lard, eggs, oil, toilet paper, chicken, sausages, tomato paste, spaghetti, beverages, churros, coffee, bread and other items. With the support of this loan, Nely expects to expand her inventory as well as her sales and improve the financial situation of her and her family a little. Her dream is to be able to buy a car.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, lard, eggs, oil, toilet paper, chicken, sausages, tomato paste, spaghetti, beverages, churros, coffee, bread and other items.

loans.name: Gopini

texts.en: Gopini is 38 years old.  She is married and has four children aged 22, 21, 20 and 4.  In 2005, she established her grocery store business.  Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buys grocery goods for her business.  In the future, Gopini plans to improve her family's economic conditions.  She thanks you for your support.  In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her business

loans.name: God Bless Iii Group

texts.en: Fea is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She was born in Gbense, in eastern Sierra Leone 30 years ago. She is married and the couple has three children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Fea has been a businesswoman for six months now. She sells ready-to-wear clothing. This is the first loan that Fea and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Fea will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to expand her business. She will use it to buy a wide variety of clothes and in a large quantity to add to her current ones.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of clothes and in a large quantity to add to her current ones

loans.name: Gyanu

texts.en: Gyanu is 49 years old.  She is married and has two children aged 31 and 26.  In 2001, she established her grocery store business.  Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy groceries for her business.  In the future, Gyanu plans to improve her family's economic conditions.  She thanks you for your support.  In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her business

loans.name: Maya

texts.en: Maya is 42 years old.  She is married and has two children aged 22 and 17.  In 2004, she established  her grocery store business.  Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy groceries for her business.  In the future, Maya plans to improve her family's economic conditions.  She thanks you for your support.  In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rice, flour, sugar, palm oil, onions, margi, pepper etc. in wholesale to add to her current stock

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La Señora Norma de 62 años, vive, en su casa de habitación ubicada en una el aldea de San Lorenzo, en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 25  años  a la elaboración de pan como ser hojaldras, roquillas, quesadillas, pan de pan, tortas, etc. 
Doña Norma vende de lunes a domingo y sus clientes son sus vecinos y amigos que a diario le visitan,  su negocio está ubicado en su casa.
Doña Norma está solicitando el préstamo para comprar productos como maíz, harina, huevos, azúcar, levadura, etc.  Para la elaboración del producto que vende.  Con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende incrementar más  su inventario y también el volumen de sus ventas.
Doña Norma su sueño comprar un carro.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – Mayo del 2013.
texts.en: Norma is 62 years old and lives in the small town of San Lorenzo in southern Honduras. She has made a living for the past 25 years making baked goods like pastries, bagels, quesadillas, loaves of bread, tortas and other items. Norma sells her products every day of the week, and her customers are friends and neighbors who visit her daily. Her business is located in her home. Norma is requesting the loan to purchase ingredients like corn, flour, eggs, sugar, yeast and other items she needs to make the products she sells. With the support of this loan, she expects to expand her inventory and her sales volume. Norma's dream is to buy a car.

loans.use: to purchase corn, flour, eggs, sugar, yeast and other items.

loans.name: Karen

texts.es:
La Señora Karen, de 22 años vive con su esposo y su hijo, en su casa de habitación ubicada en una aldea, en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 03  años a la venta de productos alimenticios.
Doña Karen sus clientes le prefieren por su buena atención su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación y vende todo lo relacionado con la canasta familiar y también tiene a la venta lo que son cargas de leña y vende de lunes a domingo.
en todas sus presentaciones, en donde le visitan todos sus vecinos y amigos,  Su negocio está ubicado en el local de su casa.
Doña Karen está solicitando  el préstamo  para la compra de manteca, huevos, aceite, papel higiénico, pollo, carne, embutidos, pastas de tomate, espaguetis, refrescos, agua, leche, arroz, frijoles, café, pan, etc. con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende incrementar mas su inventario y por ende sus ganancias, para poder cumplir con sus compromisos. 
Doña Karen su sueño es que su hijo pueda seguir sus estudios. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Mayo del 2013.
texts.en:
Karen is 22 and lives with her husband and son, in a house located in a village South of Honduras. Three years ago, she started selling basic need products.
Karen is preferred by her customers because of her good service in the business located in her residence, she sells everything related with basic need products and also sells firewood, she opens from Monday to Sunday.
Karen is requesting a loan to buy lard, eggs, oil, toilet paper, chicken, beef, sausages, tomato paste, spaghetti, soda, water, milk, rice, beans,coffee and bread for her business.  With this loan she will have more inventory and as a result increase her income and be able to meet her commitments. Karen's dream is that her son can continue to study.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - May 2013.

loans.use: to buy lard, eggs, oil, toilet paper, chicken, beef, sausages, tomato paste, spaghetti, soda, water, milk, rice, beans,coffee and bread for her business.

loans.name: Maglenis

texts.es:
Maglenis es una joven casada de 26 años de edad dedicada a las diferentes actividades que se elaboran en el hogar y en el campo. Ella junto a su esposo día tras día se levanta con el objetivo de superarse y de ser mejores cada día para darle un mejor bienestar a su hijo y un mejor futuro. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria no completado cursado hasta el 5 grado y agradece el apoyo incondicional de sus padres en ese tiempo ya que ellos se esforzaron por darle un mejor futuro pero por la falta de apoyo económico no pudieron. Uno de los problemas que ella tiene en este momento es la falta de atención y el poco mantenimiento a sus cultivos ya que los diferentes insumos que se necesitan son caros y no cuenta con un capital solido que respalde estas actividades sin descuidar las de su familia.

Ella ha solicitado un Financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para poder comprar fertilizantes, abono, urea, formula cafetalera, gramoxon entre otros que ayudaran a dar un mejor follaje y color a su cultivo de café protegiéndolo de bichos e insectos como también enfermedades como la roya.   

Su meta es poder dar asistencia a sus cultivos y cumplir puntualmente con su compromiso ya que ella tiene la fe de seguir trabajando con COMIXMUL para poder dar un desarrollo a su familia en lo económico y así poder formar un capital propio que en algún momento pueda trabajarlo y darle un mejor futuro a su hijo.
texts.en: Maglenis is a young woman of 26, married and has responsibilities in her home and in her coffee fields. She and her husband get up every day with the goal to better themselves in order to give their son a better upbringing and a brighter future. Maglenis attended elementary school but didn't complete the fifth grade. She is grateful for the unconditional support of her parents during that time because they worked hard to give her a better future but due to a lack of financial resources they couldn't. One of the problems she is facing at the moment is a lack of care and attention for her crops, since she is in need of different supplies, but they are expensive and she can't come up with the capital without neglecting her family's needs. She is requesting the loan from Kiva partner COMIXMUL in order to purchase fertilizers, manure, urea and other supplies that will help give her coffee crops better foliage and color and protect them from pests, insects and sicknesses. Her goal is to tend to her crops and punctually fulfill her requirements so she can continue working with COMIXMUL and further develop her family's finances to build some capital of her own that at some point she can put to work and give her son a better future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, manure and other supplies for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Aminata's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you this group of school teachers from the eastern city of Koidu. Together, they have come to SMT to apply for a loan of SLL 10,250,000. With the help of this loan, they are being financially empowered to meet their most immediate and most pressing financial needs. At the end of each month, they can easily repay, using their monthly salaries. It is their school's bursar whose duty it is to deduct their repayment amounts and repay SMT/Kiva lenders on their behalf.

Shar Musa is the featured leader of this team. A native of Masundu, in eastern Sierra Leone, he is married to a farmer and the couple has five children - two are attending primary school and three are in secondary school. Shar Musa has been a school teacher for 13 years now. He has requested this loan in order to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Boston A.

texts.en: Again, meet Boston, a small scale businessman from Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. He has just completed repaying his last Kiva loan of SLL 3,000,000. Having finished repaying that loan very successfully, he is applying for a new one of SLL 5,000,000. This will further enable him to buy a wide variety of drugs and in a larger quantity. Even though Boston faces a lot of challenges in his business, such as finance, he has however managed to erect a drugstore for himself where he now sells. His greatest dream is to become a great entrepreneur and a philanthropist.

loans.use: buy a wide variety of drugs and in a larger quantity

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is 46 years old and lives in Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is a married woman and mother of four children. Gina has been raising pigs for sale for years.  She earns PHP 2,000 every month for doing this business.  Gina requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.  In the future, Gina hopes to have a large-scale piggery in her town.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is married with seven adult children. She is 59 years old and lives in Taraka, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates her farm, planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been doing this business for seven years to make a living. She also engages in a buy-and-sell business as an addition to her income. 

She became a member of GDMPC in 2006 and recently, requested a loan of 3,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy chemicals and fertilizer. She hopes to have an abundant harvest in order to generate more income for the family.

loans.use: to buy chemicals and fertilizer.

loans.name: Purie

texts.en: Purie is a 37-year-old married woman with three children. She lives in Sumasap, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. For a living, she owns and operates a farm of fruit trees, banana and coconut. She became a member of GDMPC and gains access to microfinance services and recently requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to cultivate her farm to generate more income for a better future of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is 35 years old, married with two children, and lives in Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. For a living, she owns and manages a store buying and selling fish in the market. She has been doing this for five years. In 2011, she became a member of GDMPC and recently, she borrowed 21,000 PHP in order to purchase additional inventory for sale. She plans to expand her store to gain more profit for the family.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Kosal's Group

texts.en:
A young married mother in late 20s, Kosal is a resident from Ek Phnom district of Battambang Province. She has two children who are currently in school. She strives for a living through 1 hectare of rice farming as the core income-generating activity and catches fish for resale as the supplementary income. She has occupied this business for five years, earning about 20,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day. 

This is the fourth cycle loan for Kosal with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). After the successful past loan, which she has fully repaid, she managed to support her living conditions better than before. Now, she forms a group of two female members to apply for a new loan. She and her joint member are seeking 1,000,000 KHR and 1,200,000 KHR, respectively. As the leader, she will use her portion to pay for plowing fees and to buy potash for her crop. She hopes that she can boost her crop productivity, so she can make income to expand her business on a larger scale.

loans.use: To pay for plowing fees and to buy potash for her crop.

loans.name: Idrissa

texts.en:
Pictured here is Idrissa. The 34-year-old was born in Tonkolili district, northern Sierra Leone. He is married to a civil servant and the couple has two children who are attending primary school. For three years now, Idrissa has been selling chains, bracelets, make-up, hair dyes, earrings, etc. Idrissa is requesting a loan of SLL 3,000,000 for the first time from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to further expand his business. With this loan, he will buy the abovementioned items in wholesale to add to his existing stock. 

Though capital has always been a great challenge for Idrissa, he is proud that, out of the little profit he makes from his daily sales, he is in the process of erecting a dwelling house for his family. Idrissa’s dream is to become a great and influential businessman.

loans.use: to buy chains, bracelets, make-up, hair dyes, earrings, etc. in wholesale to add to his existing stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a wider variety of clothes in bulk to add to his current stock

loans.name: Sary's Group

texts.en:
Sary, a 51-year-old mother of six children, is a widow who struggles in earning a living via rice farming. Besides this agribusiness, she works at a construction site for extra income. The current business has returned her about 28,900 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day. 

This is the sixth-time loan for Sary with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Sary has fully repaid her past loan wisely, and she manages to provide sufficient food for her kids. Now, she leads a group of four to apply for a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy potash and rice seed for replanting. She hopes to make more income in order to expand her business on a bigger scale.

loans.use: To buy potash and rice seed for replanting.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta is a 57-year-old married entrepreneur from Mialem, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental with six children and is earning a living from her transport service business. Aside from this business, she also has a business buying and selling copra and charcoal.  To purchase coconut for copra and charcoal production, she is requesting an amount of PHP 7,000 from GDMPC.  Before long, she’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding her business.

loans.use: purchase coconut for copra and charcoal production

loans.name: Phally's Group

texts.en: Phally is a local farmer residing in Battambang Province’s Ek Phnom district. She is 44 years old and a widow. She has 11 children, three of whom are still in school. Her primary sources of income are from rice cropping and bean farming while the secondary source of her income is catching fish for resale. Having had this business for 22 years, Phally is able to earn up to 19,300 KHR per day. This is the first time that Phally’s group, consisting of three female members, have applied for a loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The total amount of her entire group loan is 1,900,000 KHR, of which 500,000 KHR is Phally’s portion. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy rice seed and potash for her farmland. She highly believes that she can make a good yield to sustain her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and potash for her farmland

loans.name: Hou's Group

texts.en: Age 46 and a villager from the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Hou is the mother of six children who are still in school. For her, two hectares of rice cropping and a fish-catching business are the main source of income for the sake of her family. She is able to earn about 27,500 KHR per day from the business that she has managed since she was 20 years old. This is the first loan for Hou’s group with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She and one of her co-borrowers are seeking 200,000 KHR each while the remaining member is seeking 100,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion buying potash, fertilizer, and rice seed. She hopes that she can make her yield better than before so that she can sustain her living.

loans.use: To buy potash, fertilizer, and rice seed

loans.name: Mon

texts.en:
Mon (in the photo) is single. She sells fish and vegetables. In addition to that, she also makes and sells typical Cambodian cake.
 
She lives with her brother in a village about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Mon has applied for a Kiva loan to transport fish and vegetables to the market. She now requests another to buy a motorcycle for her niece for commuting to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for her niece for commuting to work.

loans.name: Mobina's Group

texts.en: Mobina lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of three children. Her husband owns an artificial jewelry shop, which is the only source of income for the family. Her husband wants to purchase a variety of jewelry for the shop that includes bangles, necklace, rings and bracelets. Therefore, Mobina, as a member of a two-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase artificial jewelry for her husband's shop. She is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for the business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of jewelry for the shop that includes bangles, necklace, rings and bracelets.

loans.name: Kan

texts.en: Kan (pictured above) and his wife are rice farmers. Besides the farming business, he also raises cows at home. The couple has been married since 1979, and they have six children: four sons and two daughters. Four of them are married; three live in separate homes. One raises cows at home and another one is a driver for a government agency that builds roads. He does not have a motorbike for commuting; hence, Kan decided to apply for a loan of $1,500 to buy a motorcycle for his son.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for his son for commuting.

loans.name: Bombilias El Rincon Group

texts.es:
La señora Jeidy Anai es de estado civil casada, tiene 30 años de edad, de escolaridad primaria completa, tiene 3 hijos y 2 de ellos estan estudiando, ella se dedica a la crianza de pollos, inició este negocio con 5 gallinas y hasta la fecha lleva 4 años de experiencia; cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es albañil.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de 6 docenas de pollos y 5 quintales de concentrado para alimentarlas y luego venderlas, en el futuro cercano desea tener una granja no solo de pollos sino también de ganado porcino; las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la crianza de animales y a la venta de productos por catálogos.
texts.en:
Jeidy Anai, 30, received a complete primary education.  She is married and has three children, two of which are in school.  She raises chickens and started her business four years ago with five hens.  Her husband, who is a bricklayer, also supports her.

Jeidy has organized a group and is requesting a loan to buy six dozen chickens, which she will later sell, and 500 lbs of concentrated feed.  In the near future she wants to have not only chickens on her farm but also pigs.  The other members of the group raise animals and sell products by catalogue.

loans.use: To buy chickens.

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
A married father of six children, two of whom are in school, Sokha is 53 years old and a villager from Ek Phnom district of Battambang province. To deal with the daily cost of living, Sokha does rice cultivation on a 5-hectare area, bean growing on a 2-hectare area, and catches fish for resale to earn extra income. He has managed this job for ages. 

Sokha, who has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the past two cycles, has fully repaid his loan with success to support his business, and improved his living conditions better than before. Moreover, he is able to set aside some money for future needs, too. For this loan cycle, he joins with another member, who has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. As the leader, he will spend his loan portion to plow his farmland and to buy rice seed and potash. He highly believes that he can expand his business on a bigger scale and make triple income for the sake of his kids.

loans.use: to plow his farmland and to buy rice seed and potash.

loans.name: Samit's Group

texts.en:
Samit, age 45, is married and a mother of five children. The rest of her family is residing in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, where her agribusiness is running. She has been with this business for 25 years. 

Samit and her joint member are new to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In this first loan, they are seeking 1,000,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) each. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy petrol for her hand tractor and potash to support her farmland. She highly expects a good yield, better than last year, and to make more income.

loans.use: To buy petrol for her hand tractor and potash for her crop.

loans.name: Shumaila

texts.en: Shumaila lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of four children. Her husband owns a restaurant, which is the only source of income for the family. Her husband wants to purchase plates, spoons, plastic chairs and tables for the restaurant. However, due to the lack of finances, he finds it difficult. Therefore, Shumaila has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase crockery for her husband's restaurant. She is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for the business. With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to expand his business so that he can eventually construct a small house for his family. Shumaila hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase crockery for the restaurant.

loans.name: San Francisco Zona 4 Group

texts.es:
La señora Aura Marina es casada, cuenta con 53 años de edad, curso los 6 años de educación primaria, tiene 6 hijos y ni 1 estudia porque ya todos son mayores de edad, se dedica a la venta de comidas y refacciones, inició este negocio trabajando de cocinera pero ahora decidió ser independiente y tener su propio negocio, hasta la fecha lleva 26 años de experiencia en el ramo. También cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de insumos para preparar alimentos ya que tiene varios pedidos, ella comprara lo que es azucar, maíz, aceite, arroz, frijol, huevos y otros insumos que utiliza en la cocina, en el futuro cercano desea tener otro local bien acreditado para poder generar mas ingresos; las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la venta de comida, venta de tortillas y venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Aura Marina, 53, is married and has a sixth grade education.  Five of her six children are adults and one is still in school.  She started her catering business when she decided to become independent after working as a cook.  She has 26 years' experience in the sector and receives support from her husband.

Aura Marina has organized a group to request a loan that she will use to buy food supplies since she has several orders to fill.  She will buy sugar, corn, oil, rice, beans, eggs and other cooking supplies.  In the near future she would like to have a well-appointed shop to generate more income.  The other members of the group are involved in catering, tortilla sales and clothing sales.

loans.use: To buy food supplies.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Carmen, quien con su credikiva logró comprar queso, carne,  e insumos para su confección.Surtió mucho mas su negocio y logró ampliar el número de sus clientes. Hoy su negocio cuenta con mas clientes y mi nivel de vida comienza a mejorar. Carmen envia muchos agradecimientos a los finanaciadores de Kiva por permitirle hacer crecer su negocio.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo finaciamiento y con él comprará tela e inumos necesarios para su prodcción de prendas de vestir tambien comprará queso, ya que mis clientes han aumentado y están solicitando mas pedidos. Siendo así el responder a su demanda hará de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Thanks for supporting Carmen, who used her CrediKiva loan to buy cheese, meat and sewing supplies.  She was able to stock her business better and even increased her client base.  Now she has more customers and her lifestyle has begun to improve.  Carmen is very grateful to the Kiva lenders  who have helped expand her business.  

She is now requesting a new loan to buy the fabric and sewing supplies needed to make clothing.  She will also buy cheese.  Since she has more customers, she is receiving more orders which means her loan will be a successful investment.

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies and cheese.

loans.name: Moeuy's Group

texts.en:
Moeuy is 46 years old and a mother of six children residing in Sangke district of Battambang province.To sustain her family, she does corn farming as the main business. She has been engaged in the current business for 11 years. 

With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), Moeuy and her joint member are in their eighth loan cycle. She has repaid her past loan already, which enables her to upgrade her living conditions in a gradual manner. Now, she and her co-borrower are seeking for the same loan amount of 1,400,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) each. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy more rice seed for planting and to pay for plowing fees. She hopes that she can make more income and enlarge her business better than before.

loans.use: To buy more rice seed for planting and to pay plowing fees.

loans.name: Kausar

texts.en: Kausar, age 57, is a housewife. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband is a scrap dealer. This business is the only source of income for the family. Kausar is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of improving her husband's business. He will use the loan amount to purchase scrap iron, aluminum and plastic bottles for his business. With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to invest in household needs. Kausar hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase scrap iron, aluminum and plastic bottles.

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en:
Rabia is a 29-year-old married woman. She is a mother of four children. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband owns a betel shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. 

Rabia is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He will use the loan amount to purchase products for his shop, so that he can respond quickly to customer needs. He plans to expand his business with the additional income he earns. Rabia hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase products for her husband's betel shop.

loans.name: Romario

texts.es: Romario de 20 años de edad, se dedica al alquiler de lavadoras desde el año 2010, pues su amigo, antiguo propietario de este negocio le pidió asociarse con él y hoy en día ya es de propiedad de Romario, porque él, su amigo,  debió irse a estudiar, dejándole su parte a Romario. Su negocio lo realiza desde su domicilio  en un horario que va desde las 7 de la mañana hasta la 9 de la noche a sus clientes que son principalmente sus vecinos del sector. Su meta es lograr aumentar su clientela para generar ingresos y poder pagarse una buena educación. En la actualidad Romario está aplicando a un credikiva tercer financiamiento que hace a Fundación Maro Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará 3 lavadoras más, para potencializar el acceso de nuevos clientes y así iniciar su sueño de prosperidad.
texts.en:
Romario, 20, has been in the washing machine rental business since 2010.  A friend of his, who was the owner of the business, asked him to join the company and now Romario is the full owner since his friend had to go off to study and left his part to Romario.  He works from home from 7:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. tending to customers who mainly are neighbors.

His goal is to increase his customer base to generate enough income to pay for a good education.  Romario is currently requesting his third CrediKiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  He will use it to buy three more washing machines so he can have access to new customers and begin striving toward his goal of prosperity.

loans.use: To buy three washing machines.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra es una mujer de 35 años que se dedica a lo que son los oficios domésticos en su casa de habitación y también apoya a su esposo en lo que es el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café. Juntos en familia se dirigen a su cultivo de café para seguir mejorándolo y ampliándolo ya que de esa forma ellos podrán darles a sus 2 hijos los cuales el mayor está en el colegio en 2 años y el menor en la escuela y ayudan a sus padres en las diferentes actividades al salir de las actividades escolares. Sandra tiene un grado de educación primario no completado cursado hasta el 4 grado pero no pudo continuar por la falta de apoyo económico por parte de sus padres. La tierra que trabaja es propia gracias a una herencia que sus padres le dejaron para que ella pudiese tener un respaldo y poder trabajar para generar ingresos para su familia y hogar.

Sandra ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para la compra de abonos, fertilizantes entre otros que ayudaran a que sus cultivos se mantengan sanos y seguros para la cosecha.

Sus sueños con los de ver a sus hijos graduados y con un nivel de profesionalismo superior, así como los de ampliar más sus cultivos para generar mayores ingresos y poder cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Sandra, 35, is a homemaker and also helps her husband with the care and maintenance of their coffee crop.  They work together to continue improving and expanding their plantation in order to provide for their two school-aged children who also help their parents when they get out of school.  Sandra has a fourth grade education and was unable to finish her education because her parents could not pay for it.  She owns the land they work on which she inherited from her parents who wanted her to have a means of generating an income for the family.

Sandra has requested a loan through the COMIXMUL co-operative to buy fertilizers that will keep her crops healthy and safe until harvest time.

Sandra's goal is to see her children graduate and become professionals.  She also wants to grow more crops to generate more income so she can realize her dreams.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Sarswati

texts.en:
Sarswati is 40 years old. She is married and has three children aged 19, 15 and 10. In 2010, she established her grocery store business.  Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supoorts her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buys grocery goods for her business. In the future, Sarswati plans to uplift the economic conditon of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called pasals, are an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce; milk; and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her business.

loans.name: Maan

texts.en:
Maan is 40 years old. She is married and has one child, aged 22. In 2011, she established her grocery store business.  Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supoorts her family. In the future, Maan plans to uplift the economic conditon of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called pasals, are an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce; milk; and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her business.

loans.name: Shanti

texts.en:
Shanti is 24 years old. She is married and has one child, aged 6. In 2008, she established her poultry farming business.  Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy small chickens for her business. In the future, Shanti plans to uplift the economic conditon of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, raising poultry for eggs and meat is a very profitable business. Kiva loans are used to purchase chicks, food, and necessary medicine to keep the chickens healthy. Once matured, the chickens are sold at small butcher shops or in the many open air markets throughout the valley.

loans.use: to buy small chickens.

loans.name: David Remberto

texts.es:
David, tiene 31 años de edad, vive con sus padres. El, se dedica a las actividades agropecuarias tales como cultivo de maíz y a la ganadería para apoyar con los gastos del hogar, el oficio lo aprendió desde pequeño con sus padres y lo realiza de lunes a sábado.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar los materiales agrícolas necesarios tales como: herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, abono, entre otros; esta inversión le ayudara a aumentar la capacidad de cambio, mejorar la productividad para obtener  mayores ganancias.
Su sueño es incrementar sus ingresos para brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y familiares.
texts.en:
David is 31 years old and lives with his parents.  He makes a living in farming, with work such as growing corn and raising cattle in order to help with household costs.  David learned his trade from a young age with his parents and he works from Monday to Saturday,

David needs a loan that will allow him to buy necessary farming materials, such as herbicides, pesticides, insecticides, manure and more. This investment will allow David to increase capacity and improve productivity in order to increase his profits.

David's dream is to increase his income so that he can give his children and family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy herbicides, pesticides, insecticides, manure and more.

loans.name: Jose Reynaldo

texts.es:
José, requiere optar por un nuevo préstamo porque necesita más capital de trabajo para seguir invirtiendo en la siembra de granos básicos; este le permitirá comprar los insumos agropecuarios tales como: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a aumentar la producción, sus ingresos los invierte en los gastos del hogar; las condiciones económicas han mejorado gracias a la inversión que realizo con el crédito de Kiva,  se encuentra muy bien de salud él y su familia.
texts.en:
José needs another loan because he needs more working capital in order to continue investing in sowing basic grains.  This loan will allow him to buy farming supplies such as manure, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides and more.

José previous loan helped him to increase production.  His invested his income in household costs.  His financial situation has improved, thanks to the investment he made with his Kiva loan.  Both José and his family are in good health.

loans.use: to buy manure, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and to buy wood to fix the roof on her home.

loans.name: Sameera

texts.en:
Sameera lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of four children. 

Sameera's husband sells soaps and detergents which is the only source of income for the family. Her husband wants to purchase soap and detergents in larger quantities. However due to the lack of funds, he finds it difficult. Therefore, Sameera has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase soap and detergents for her husband's shop. 

She is hopeful that the loan will be productive for the business. With the profits expected from this loan, her husband intends to expand his business so that he can eventually construct a small house for his family.

Sameera is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase soap and detergents for her husband's shop.

loans.name: Sari Rasa Group

texts.en:
Bali is one of the attractions visited by foreign tourists and local people. In addition to its beautiful attractions, visitors to Bali can also see the most dominant industry - locals working in the agricultural sector. The people of Bali not only work in the fields, but also raise pigs. In this case, raising pigs is mostly done by the housewife. However, due to constraints, they are not familiar with the best way to raise pigs. To increase their knowledge in animal husbandry, the women agreed to form a group that will be able to exchange information about how to raise pigs in a good and right way. They will also get funding to improve their business.

Ni Luh Gede is a 38-year-old housewife, and is the leader of the Sari Rasa group. To enhance their ability to raise pigs and get capital for their businesses, the group decided to request a loan through MUK. Ni Luh Gede's loan portion will be used to purchase four piglets and feed. The pig will then be ready for re-sale within six months. The benefits of this will be used entirely to support the family.

loans.use: to purchase four piglets and feed.

loans.name: Mukhtara

texts.en:
Mukhtara lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of eight children. Her husband owns an artificial jewellery shop, which is the only source of income for the family. 

Mukhtara's husband wants to purchase a variety of jewellery for the shop, such as bangles, necklaces, rings and bracelets. Therefore, Mukhtara has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase artificial jewellery for her husband's shop. She is hopeful that the loan will be productive for the business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of jewellery for her husband's shop, such as bangles, necklaces, rings and bracelets.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 39 years old and has two children. She lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her main business is selling pop corn, a business she started with the vision of supporting her family. She is very hardworking.

Sarah dreams of starting up a poultry farm and educating her children to higher levels of learning, despite facing challenges of low capital and price fluctuation. Sarah will use the loan to buy maize seedlings for making pop corn.

loans.use: to buy maize seedlings for making pop corn.

loans.name: Nazia's Group

texts.en:
Nazia is a 30-year-old mother if four children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. 

Nazia's husband owns a fruit shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He sells apples, bananas and oranges in his shop. He is keen on offering more variety to his customers, which will help him to increase his net income and savings as well. However due to the lack of funds, he finds it difficult. Therefore, his wife Nazia, as a member of a two-person group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase a variety of fruits from the field, and then sell them in the market at profitable price. 

With the profits, Nazia's husband wants to grow his business in the future. Nazia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakiatan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fruits from the field and sell them in the market at profitable price.

loans.name: Kakoni Traders Group

texts.en: Aida is a thirty-two-year old married woman with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. She is shown in the photo wearing a white t-shirt. She operates a retail shop and also mines salt for a living. The good mother that she is, she wants to educate her children to attain degrees as a minimum qualification and set them up for income generating activities that can secure their future. Lack of capital and bad weather are her challenges while her business goal is to trade on a wholesale basis. She is a member of the abovementioned group where each one guarantees the other in accessing a loan. Aida intends to use the loan facility to buy salt and cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: To pay for salt and cassava flour

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 53-year-old married man with nine children, living in Kasese, Uganda. 

David has been a primary teacher for eleven years, and he also does pastoral work. He started teaching in order to inspire the young generation.
